Short Goal

$1,000
Help us reach 1,000 and we will upload a mini demo, so that you can test the game now!

Stretched Goals

$30,000 
Game Completion and uploaded to Steam! 
$50,000
Quit our day jobs and speed up the game release to 4 months, as well as showcase our game at the next GDC 2015!
$70,000
Release the game onto Playstation 4 and Xbox One!

$100,000
Give everyone who donated even a dolla
r a Plush Doll


Risks & Challenges
Game was originally started in UDK, but thanks to Unreal's continuation of making a great engine. We have started over in Unreal 4, the results have been promising thus far. 

The following is a dubbed and rough cut of the UDK verison we were originally using.

We have really spent a lot of time and money to be 
able to make a game that we hope will make an impact. We believe in it and would not be asking for your assistance if we did not.
This biggest challenge might be having a successful Indiegogo. In reality you have nothing to lose if you enjoy playing games, because this game will be just as fulfilling as any game you have ever played. The only thing you have to lose out on, is an opportunity to be first to get your copy of A Wizard's Wasteland game.
First time testing out the new Unreal 4
Exactly one Month later here's what we have added using Unreal 4

Who are we and what do we do?




Join our competition!


Create your very own Dumpling with real garbage! We will vote for the top 3 favorite creations and the winners will have their name in credits plus see their creation modeled and become an enemy in the game!

story:
Because of the destruction of his planet by the Gigantic Chimera, the little alien Gédéon, narrowly escaped his galaxy to find another place to live. After travelling for years in the intergalactic space, his spaceship run out of fuel and crashed on a strange and wild planet named Kapiata where a wild and primitive tribe lives, the Atakapus. This planet turns to be as dangereous as its habitants and many dangers are hidden in the shadow of the Kapu Mont, a colossal volcano.

Gédéon will be to collect atomic fuel and pieces to fix his ship in order to quickly escape to find a safer place to live.


Atakapu is a 2.5D speedrun oriented platformer videogame. The main gameplay is based on a switch wich allows you to choose between different costumes that will give you special abilities. For the moment, there are two types of gameplays: the Agility and the Attack mode. The concept of our game will be to switch gameplays during the game so that at anytime to can adapt to the environment, platforms and enemies you encounter.

The goal of every level is to finish as fast as possible with the maximum of orbs that give you points.


At the begining of the game , Gedeon has no costume and he can only do single jumps.


After you have passed the level 1, you will unlock the agility costume for Gedeon and you can now play him from level 2.


The next costume that you will unlock is the attack costume.

Take note that if you are in agility mode, you can wall jump, double jump and grapple but you can't attack or dash enemies. In the same way , if you are on attack mode, you can't use abilities from agility mode. The timing of the switch will be important in certain situation to obtain the best time and score !


* One of our ideas is to create creature levels in which you'll be able to ride a cute creature and rush levels specially made for it.

We dream and wish to continue our project and launch our first game. We need your help to achieve this project. We truly believe in Atakapu! This project is our baby and we will raise it until it will become a fully grown up video game! And it will be so much cooler if you all help us and show us your support! 



At this time of the development we already have 3 playable levels with online scoring. We already implemented the agility costume wich is fully functional except for the grapple wich still need some tweaking on the code. Right now we are focusing on the improvement of the attack costume, on new gameplay mechanics, on solving the bugs and on graphics.  


The planet Kapiata where our main character crashed is actually our level selection menu. There you have the possibility to see the top 3 of each level (on the right), your better score (on the left) as well as the switch mode to get to the "time attack" mode and an access to the general ranking ( Y or R).

As you can see on the top of the selection level menu we already implemented two different game modes so there will be two general ranking, one for each mode.

                       

On the Normal Mode the score is based on your time and the amount of orbs you collected.
On the Attack Mode you score is only based on your timing so hurry up!

Once you have finished one level on normal mode, you will automatically unlock the time attack mode as well as the normal mode for the next level.

For our main menu we decided to bring out the magical ambiance of the planet Kapiata and to allow the players to see all the 2 main characters of Atakapu and all the costumes in one place.

The level design has been made and thought for a speedrun and dynamic gameplay. You will need to be accurate on you jumps, double jumps, walljumps, attacks and dashes to save a few seconds and beat your friends score!
We would also like to make an addition to the HUD and create a complementary pannel wich will show you if you are winning or loosing time compared to your best time.  It's a common thing to see in speedrunner or racing game and we think it might be great for you to see your progression in game.


Haaaaa! We finally can introduce you to the Atakapus! Those little creatures live on Kapiata the planet where our main characer crashed. The Atakapu's are not really friendly with strangers and might even be dangereous for anyone coming from an other world. Too bad for you! Now they are after you and will try to stop you by any means they have in their possession. Luckily for you, you also have some great weapons on your side as your costumes and abilities! You will be able to fight back or even dodge their attacks if there is too many of them!

At this time of the development we already have two versions of the Atakapus:

The Range Atakapu: This one uses his blowpipe to throw poisoned projectile at you!

The Melee Atakapu: This one charges you and tries to kill you with his spear!





We would like to had some levels with bosses. We already did some graphic and gameplay researches. One of the sketches that we made has been selected and here is our first boss project. He is not in the game yet but he will be with your help!

This boss is a lava creature who has been tamed by Atakapus and who will fight for them to protect their planet. He is gigantic and has large paws that you will need to avoid if you don't want to die in horrible pain. He also has large spine and tail spikes and will use them to hit and hurt you. We don't know yet but he also might be able to spit fire like dragons. 

Those attacks are just ideas at this time and we still have plenty others to make our game even cooler! 



We are constantly searching for new graphic ideas. Here are some researches that uour concept artist made for the first levels.





We have some great ideas for the future of the game. Here are some of them:

We would like to create an aquatic costume which will give us the opportunity to make underwater levels. This costume might be an other version of the attatck costume and will allow you to dash and throw bubbles at new ennemies.

We also thought about adding a ghost of your best time in game. This will help you to know where to go and how to save time compared to your past times.

An other idea is to create creature levels in which you'll be able to ride a cute creature and run levels specially made for it.

There is also a project to create an infinite level in the great volcano, Kappu Mont, where you will need all of your strenght to go as far as you can.





The first challenge encountered is that we are unknow from video game industry and therefore we don't have a big community behing us to follow and share our game. We are currently working on our communication and to continue to expand our community.

An other challenge is that we are trying to make rich 3D environment while our gameplay is only 2D by adding depth to our scene. It demands to spend more time on the creation of each new level because we pay attention to every details of our environment. We already have good feedbacks for the graphics in our game and are proud to offer enhanced environment.



We are a young belgian indie team who just graduated from a graphic design school specialized in video games and located in Namur, Belgium. We are actually creating a video game in a team of 5 under the name "FrostyFroggs".

Our game "Atakapu" was our final school project and right after being graduated we decided to continue and try our dream come true: make a video game and create fun!

Our team is composed of 1 developer and 4 artists.



It's our first project together and we are thrilled to share it with you guys! We hope that you enjoyed getting to know our game and that you'll have lots of fun playing it! 

We wil see you soon in the scoring panel ;) meanwhile we are continuing to work on "Atakapu" for you!

Here is some pictures of us working in our spot at the MOOF Museum located in Bruxelles, Belgium.





You can help us by sharing our project and our facebook page to all your friends that could be intersted.

You can also help us if you can provide us free advertising 


website : http://atakapu.com/

Facebook page : https://www.facebook.com/Atakapu?ref=bookmarks

story:
The books were sent to you. Thanks for your help! 

Thank you for funding our product! This way we can bring you new product soon! I have also a big request - funders with perk Barbarian warrior or higher – please email me at pkorys@gmail.com, I have to send you a file, so you could name your monster. This way we can have time for working it out in August! Thanks! 

New GOAL!

If we manage to get $750, we will add additional chapter - Disciples of the Black Temple!

Watch out for the tall, gaunt men wandering in the roads of Caldeia City wielding dark staves made of polished wood, because death walks on their side! They are the dreaded Disciples of the Black Temple, masters
of shadows and shapers of flesh.

Thanks to all for your funds!

 Beasts of the Dominions

  • The mysterious Mulhere hunting in the tall grass of the Ivory Savannah…
  • The Yellowfingers lurking in the darkest tombs of the Cairnlands…
  • The Yarakan, dreaming memories of a fallen empire…
  • Ten monsters of the Dread Sea Dominions, each with a dedicated Savage Tale, await you within.
  •              Grab your battleaxe, ready your bow, and prepare to face the Beasts of the Dominions!
 
This book presents ten monsters and NPCs typical of the Dread Sea Dominions, complete with stats, descriptions, and a complete Heroic Tale you can use as a stand-alone adventure, or customize to fit your campaign.
 
The scenarios are designed for a party of 4-6 Seasoned heroes, but you can alter them for more experienced groups. They can be played in any order, though some tales work better in the given sequence (check each tale’s Requirements). Each scenario also includes a Hook, which you can use as inspiration for your own stories as well.
 
Each group of foes is based in a different area of the Dominions and evenly distributed across the lands, giving your party opposition in each major nation of the setting. However, you can relocate them to countries work better for your campaign.
 
  Beasts of the Dominions is an upcoming sourcebook for "Beasts and Barbarians Golden Edition" - sword and sorcery Savage Worlds open setting from GRAmel.

story:
EDIT: Please read our rules for having your own content or putting your own content in the catalog here.

 

Who are we?

Hi, my name is Alex. I am 17 years old and I live in Las Vegas, Nevada. My Co-Owner Seth, 17, lives in California. We have never met, but we have been friends online for almost seven years. Early January we began a website called Social Meeps where you could create a meep, a meep is a blob with a face you can decorate with hats. Social Meeps has a wide variety catalog with different variety of faces, bodies, and accessories for your meep.

Social Meeps first started as a simple chat room, until mid may when we began a multiplayer hangout game, similar to those of the Disney game Club Penguin - as you roll around and chat with friends or make some new ones. The community of Social Meeps is very small, allowing you to get to know the community a lot better.

Why do we need funding?

The issue we are having with Social Meeps is, of course, advertising. We want to get the word of Social Meeps out to the public, and to do that of course is to find a source of funding. There have been over 4,000 accounts made on Social Meeps so far, but we want to get the word out there on advertising services like Google Adwords and Adbrite to bring in more kids and have our community grow.

What are the perks?

You will be able to see all the perks, depending on how much you donate, on the right. If you purchase a something as small at the Being Awesome perk, you're just awesome and amazing for taking the time to donate. However, purchasing a larger perk will give you everything above it (including being awesome)!

 

The History of Social Meeps

Social Meeps was originally founded by Seth. The site started out as he was developing his PHP and HTML skills on a simple website called Monster Planet. It didn't have a main purpose. Monster Planet had no actual users, but you could customize your character. Monster Planet's avatars used the same images as the current Social Meeps. Eventually, Seth decided to make a new website and start over as Monster Planet was becoming a rough draft. He moved on to a new website named Blob Universe, which still used the same avatar images. In Blob Universe, you could actually login, register, and communicate with other users. It had a light-blue and white color scheme and looked relatively professional. After Blob Universe became old, Seth moved on to another website named GyroPanda. The words "gyro" and "panda" were completely random and didn't have any relativity to the actual site. However, later he decided that the "meeps" should be called "pandas", even though they had no physical appearance that was relative to an actual panda. The site looked much more professional, and included a forum, status updates, profiles, a shop, and character customization. GyroPanda built up about 200 users. Seth decided that the site was becoming successful, and he purchased a paid-webhost with a .com domain. He moved GyroPanda to the new host and renamed the website to PandaFi. This site kept the same design as GyroPanda, but continued to progress and new features were built, such as a private-messaging system along with friend requests. The site eventually built up to about 400 users and became somewhat popular. Regardless of Seth's lack of motivation to work on the site, nobody complained for more, but this led to Seth going months without working on the site which led to it becaming extremely inactive. Seth decided that he didn't want a kid-based website, and he scratched the website and went to work on a more professional social-networking website such as Facebook or Google+. However, his lack-of-motivation led him to never start it. Months later, Alex missed PandaFi and had an extreme urge to bring it back to life. He bugged Seth to put the site back up for weeks. After Seth was tired of the nagging, he finally gave in and decided to put the website back up. There was a problem, though, in which Seth could not find the SQL database for the site, which led him to taking the site back down. This had Alex in frustration as he thought PandaFi was a great website and had much potential. With this motivation, Alex decided to put the website back up himself and completely overhaul it. One night, Alex chatted Seth to send him all the files of PandaFi so that he could bring it to life. Seth gave in and sent him the website the next morning. With Alex being a mediocre web developer, he didn't need Seth's code, so he coded his own. However, with Alex's lack of graphic design, he used Seth's graphics with his permission. Seth decided that he would help with the site by continuing to make assets, or hats and accessories to the site. Later, as Seth realized that Alex was building the website with his own images, he realized that the site was starting to look unprofessional. Seth forced Alex to use his images as he was disgusted by the pixelated-looking design. This new site started out of Alex's imgBomb server with the name "GrassySpace", but as the ".com" domain was taken, Alex decided to rename it to Social Meeps. Social Meeps led Seth in awe as Alex made chats and other features in real-time with PubNub. Seth saw that the site was having lots of potential and decided he would help with graphics and administration. Alex made Seth co-owner.

There have been over 4,000 accounts made on Social Meeps so far, but we want to get the word out there on advertising services like Google Adwords and Adbrite to bring in more kids and have our community grow.
What are the perks?
You will be able to see all the perks, depending on how much you donate, on the right. If you purchase a something as small at the Being Awesome perk, you're just awesome and amazing for taking the time to donate. However, purchasing a larger perk will give you everything above it (including being awesome)!
 
The History of Social Meeps
Social Meeps was originally founded by Seth. The site started out as he was developing his PHP and HTML skills on a simple website called Monster Planet. It didn't have a main purpose. Monster Planet had no actual users, but you could customize your character. Monster Planet's avatars used the same images as the current Social Meeps. Eventually, Seth decided to make a new website and start over as Monster Planet was becoming a rough draft. He moved on to a new website named Blob Universe, which still used the same avatar images. In Blob Universe, you could actually login, register, and communicate with other users. It had a light-blue and white color scheme and looked relatively professional. After Blob Universe became old, Seth moved on to another website named GyroPanda. The words "gyro" and "panda" were completely random and didn't have any relativity to the actual site. However, later he decided that the "meeps" should be called "pandas", even though they had no physical appearance that was relative to an actual panda. The site looked much more professional, and included a forum, status updates, profiles, a shop, and character customization. GyroPanda built up about 200 users. Seth decided that the site was becoming successful, and he purchased a paid-webhost with a .com domain. He moved GyroPanda to the new host and renamed the website to PandaFi. This site kept the same design as GyroPanda, but continued to progress and new features were built, such as a private-messaging system along with friend requests. The site eventually built up to about 400 users and became somewhat popular. Regardless of Seth's lack of motivation to work on the site, nobody complained for more, but this led to Seth going months without working on the site which led to it becaming extremely inactive. Seth decided that he didn't want a kid-based website, and he scratched the website and went to work on a more professional social-networking website such as Facebook or Google+. However, his lack-of-motivation led him to never start it. Months later, Alex missed PandaFi and had an extreme urge to bring it back to life. He bugged Seth to put the site back up for weeks. After Seth was tired of the nagging, he finally gave in and decided to put the website back up. There was a problem, though, in which Seth could not find the SQL database for the site, which led him to taking the site back down. This had Alex in frustration as he thought PandaFi was a great website and had much potential. With this motivation, Alex decided to put the website back up himself and completely overhaul it. One night, Alex chatted Seth to send him all the files of PandaFi so that he could bring it to life. Seth gave in and sent him the website the next morning. With Alex being a mediocre web developer, he didn't need Seth's code, so he coded his own. However, with Alex's lack of graphic design, he used Seth's graphics with his permission. Seth decided that he would help with the site by continuing to make assets, or hats and accessories to the site. Later, as Seth realized that Alex was building the website with his own images, he realized that the site was starting to look unprofessional. Seth forced Alex to use his images as he was disgusted by the pixelated-looking design. This new site started out of Alex's imgBomb server with the name "GrassySpace", but as the ".com" domain was taken, Alex decided to rename it to Social Meeps. Social Meeps led Seth in awe as Alex made chats and other features in real-time with PubNub. Seth saw that the site was having lots of potential and decided he would help with graphics and administration. Alex made Seth co-owner.

story:
Amazing Bobo was a dream come true for me when i first launched it on App store, This game is totally One man crew story, I have sketched, Draw, Colored, Animate all the characters inside this game, Even Music and Teaser Videos and trailers i have made by myself, I am looking for support/Ideas and Obviously Funds to make this game possibly for every platform and with a totally different 3D world, I am not a guy who can do 3D Characters that is why i will be hiring a 3D Artist/Animator to create all the characters for this game, not only characters but over all world for Amazing Bobo.

This Project is a Remodel of the Old Amazing Bobo was on App Store Worldwide and successfully downloaded and loved by thousands of users. My main goal is to successfully create *Amazing Bobo 3D* with your support for Every Single Platform Exist. App Store, Google Play, Blackberry, Windows Mobile, Facebook, Tagged etc. almost every where and for that i am looking for your support and funds.

The Story of this game initially was there are few friends and one of their friend is missing and they don't know where their friend is and they want to find their friends and they find so many obstacles and enemies on the way to fulfill their mission but the new story will be totally different and exciting. 

Amazing Bobo is currently in 2D world, But the new design aims are to have this overall amazing experience in 3D world, this will change a complete playing experience in this game.

Currently this game has not so many characters, The main sweet bird *Amazing Bobo* and some of her friends and some cute but deadly enemies but in the new version there will be so many characters and enemies as well and lot of new and amazing features.

One more thing will be very interesting, have you ever thought of seeing yourself struggling/jumping/firing etc in a game ? Well, I would like to add those people who are going to support my game and fund me higher will add them inside a game, like a game character, means if you like to play with for example *Justin* there will be a 3D character of Justin inside a Character Selection.

Another thing will be very interesting is i would like to introduce a power ups with your names for example, If your name is Josh and you like to have a power of your name e.g; Josh Retro Jet pack, Isn't that funny and cool ?

My Plan is to develop this game in a very new way and for all the platform you name one. From App store to Google Play Store to PlayStation to Wii almost everywhere.I am sure with your support and contribution we will be able to make this Game better with a Solid Game Play !

Well, I would like to print Tees with a space where i can add Personal message. You choose a character you like and let me know your message and i will send the shirt to you of your size :-) Cool ?

If you cant contribute, Please share Ideas with me, I would highly appreciate your ideas, and please share this to the world of yours so i can get some support and funds.

story:
Short Summary


  • Hello, we are Mythmon Crew. We are trying to make a social, battling, capturing monster game. The date has not been decided yet for release. Still in development.
  • We hope to bring a new version of monster battling to kids everywhere. This campaign is for  raising starter money for our game. We wish to release this game on PC and later on Apple Macintosh.
  • This will let our game become a reality for you and for us.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We want to let the world know that a small team of people can do big things. We want to try to make more games of Mythmon eventually.
  • We are making 300+ monsters. There will be 24 arenas. The evil team members will be Team Gem and Team Metal.                                  
  • This money will help us develop the game. We have worked on over 50 pages of the story board.

The Impact


  • This will help us make the graphics and develop the story board into the game.
  • We love adventure games and RPG games, so we hope to make a game that everyone will enjoy.
  • We are younger than most game developers, but we have experience in coding. We hope you trust us enough to contribute in money.

Risks & Challenges


  • We have experience in coding but, we might not release this for a while. With your help we can buy professional programs to help us code much better products.
  • The L.A.N. feature to help people play multiplayer through the same network will not be added for a while, until we can finish this.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • We ask you to tell everyone on social media or, your friend and family about our game to contribute.
  • Also remember to use the Indiegogo share buttons. Thank You!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Hello IndieGoGo, we're Paul, Josh & Scott

We're a small little independent game developers based in the UK and US and by our powers combined we are Cap ... oh! Sorry! We're Fossil Games. Currently we are working our backsides off to create our first full length title, Camp Sunshine. We're all middle-aged and rather dull and like to spend our time in front of screens either doodling, coding, writing or coming up with ingenious little puzzles! 

Camp Sunshine is now 'coming soon' on Steam!

http://store.steampowered.com/app/457570/

What Is Camp Sunshine?

Camp Sunshine is our first full length game and sees you take on the role of Jez (or whatever you'd like to call him) as he gets dropped off at Summer Camp. He awakes in the middle of the night to find his camp deserted and covered in blood as the terrifying Isaac Illerman comes back from the dead to wreak his revenge against the campers!

You'll be able to explore the entire camp, from dorms and shacks to the head offices, counsellors quarters and lunch rooms as you piece together why Isaac is still at large and try to put an end to the bloodshed.

As our "hero" Jez, you will be armed with your trusty flashlight. However, the batteries do run out so you'll need to explore the camp to find supplies, batteries, energy drinks, food and diary pages to unlock the hidden past!

The game is a homage to 16 bit RPG's from our youth, and our favourite genre too! We grew up watching Jason, Freddy, The Candyman and Hellraiser and want to create a game that proves that it's about the story and atmosphere rather than fancy graphics with trillions of polygons!

Where The Money Will Go ...

We became fully funded on the 8th of April 2016, thank you to everybody that donated to our project, we are amazed and humbled by your faith in our game. Camp Sunshine has now been marked as 'In Demand' and as such we can continue to raise money to make the game even better ... We raised a total of $1195, and this is going to be put towards the following ...

  • Custom artwork for our cover!
  • Audio & Dialogue Recording
  • Steam Greenlight Fees
  • Apple Developer Costs
  • Android Store Fees
  • A Little Bit of Marketing

The game is already well underway with the engine secure and our talented artist Josh beavering away creating awesome 16-bit sprites of people with their heads cut off and counsellors having "fun" in the woods.

We all work full time jobs and everything so far has come out of our own pockets, we'd like your help to push Camp Sunshine that little bit further and get it on all available platforms without any form of in-game advertising!

We would also like to add further content to the game including things like custom music and dialogue too! We want this game to be the best it can be!

Why Should You Donate?

The choice is yours, but we firmly believe we are creating a game that will make you pine for the good old days of gaming & horror! Here's what Camp Sunshine offers ...

  • A great story written by a superb horror writer.
  • A diverse cast filled with unique characters.
  • A fantastic soundtrack created just for this game.
  • Unique pixel art that will make you pine for the good-old-days.
  • A game filled with homages to famous 80s horror franchises.

With your backing we'll be able to make this game even better, get it onto all available platforms and maybe our mothers will finally be proud of us!?

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We'd be delighted if you'd hit the sharing buttons and spread word of our campaign. We really can't do this without your help. 

Platforms

Camp Sunshine will be releasing on PC, Mac and Mobile.

story:
SFU Servers is an upcoming Game Server and VoIP (voice over ip) Hosting Company.  The project has been in its planning stages for quite some time, but recently made the jump to actually push forward.  The website is still under development, but is rapidly approaching completion.  A dedicated server will be required to finish website configuration and needed for testing before launch.

Currently, sfuservers.com only shows a temporary page, but the development site can be found here: dev.sfuservers.com

Please note that Prices and Content are subject to change before the website officially launches.

If you have any questions, please feel free to contact us via our facebook page, or through the contact form on the development website.

At Launch, we plan to offer the following services for rental:

 Game Servers

  • ARMA II
  • Counter-Strike
  • Counter-Strike: Condition Zero
  • Counter-Strike: Global Offensive
  • Counter-Strike: Source
  • DayZ
  • Garry's Mod
  • Left 4 Dead
  • Left 4 Dead 2
  • Minecraft
  • Team Fortress 2
  • Terraria

 VoIP Servers

  • Mumble

 After launch, other planned services include:

  • ARMA III
  • Cube World
  • Team Speak 3
  • Ventrilo

We will be adding more services, these are only examples.  Services added will also be based on customer feedback and upcoming game popularity.

 

Currently, we have registered two domains for SFU Servers:

sfuservers.com

sfuservers.net

The webhosting has been paid for a year in advance. The website is hosted seperately from the game servers and game/voice server control panel to avoid any security threats that may occur in the future.

Right now, we are seeking the funds necessary to rent our first dedicated server at a datacenter in Buffalo, New York.  The amount that we are shooting for on indiegogo will cover approximately a year.  If things go well, we will be acquiring additional servers across the United States, and plan on expanding into overseas territory at a later date once the company takes off.

We are estimating 2-3 weeks to finish server/website configuration before the website actually goes live.  We are extremely passionate about this project and are really pushing to succeed!

 

After doing a lot of research regarding Game Hosting Companies, it seems like a lot of them are run by younger individuals, and not always taken seriously.  With this, you sometimes get the occassional unprofessional attitude and lack of or delayed support.

SFU Servers will be run by responsible adults, with too much time on their hands, with a passion for gaming!

Aside from our excellent customer support, we will also offer the following:

  • No Contracts
  • No Server Branding
  • Mod Support
  • TCAdmin
  • Automatic Re-Installations
  • Log Files
  • FTP Access
  • No Setup Fees
  • 3 Day Money Back Guarantee

More details can be found on the development website.

 

All contributors will receive the Thank You Perk.  Also, please note that these are different levels, and will not work backwards.  

Example: If you contribute to the Tier 3 Perk, you DO NOT also receive the Tier 1 and Tier 2 Perks.  Only the Tier 3 Perk and the Thank You Perk.

 

We understand that not everyone has the money to contribute to our cause, but if you like what we are trying to accomplish, please feel free to spread the word about the project!  Every little bit helps us out!

story:
Greetings Future WePosers of the World!

Once upon a time, five friends were at a bar in Buenos Aires shouting out random scenarios then posing outrageously and laughing hysterically. One friend suggested that this would be a great mobile app. Five light bulbs went off and WePose was born!

After months of Skype calls, dirty jokes and startup sass, WePose is now ready to come out of the app closet. Why? So Posers around the world can experience just how fun taking photos can be. And, so the world can be little more awesome.

 

But WEPOSE NEEDS YOUR HELP!

We've pooled our funds together, and our WePose developer is waiting with baited breath. We are now hoping to raise the final funds for programming and business startup costs.

 

We thought of selling our souls, but then thought maybe, just maybe, our generous and super cool friends and family could better help us reach our goal. Guess what? That's you guys!

 

Top 5 Reasons To Donate To WePose:

5. It'll be the best app you ever download. Like, ever.

4. We will pose however you want us to (just keep it classy).

3. The Karma Fairy will sprinkle you with good luck dust and you will win the lottery (and be able to donate more $$ to WePose...horray!)

2. The laughter caused by playing WePose will give you washboard abs. Cheaper than a gym membership.

1. Not only will you help us make our entrepreneurial dreams a reality (aww), but you can say you helped launch the greatest app to ever hit the app store. Fact.

 

Look what happened when we took WePose to the streets...

 

 

 

Conclusion? Everyone LOVES to play WePose! So, let's make this happen, Posers! 

We love you and appreciate your support. Like, seriously. It's insane how much we love you. It's not healthy.

 

 Oh yeah, here's the WePose Team that loves you so much:

 

Holly is a Content Writer for KillerStartups.com, a tech startup publication. With a background in education and marketing, Holly has extensive contacts in the startup world and acts as the team's content and marketing director and public relations officer.

 

Kate Panuska, a recent MBA from NYU's Stern School of Business, has a background in running small start-up operations. She has touched on all aspects of small business operations, marketing and development. Her current position in event planning gives her access to the media world of NYC.

 

Genevieve Panuska is the Deputy Art Director at Martha Stewart Weddings and is an experienced graphic designer. She is the design guru of WePose, crafting the logo, website, app pages and overall creative vision for the brand.

story:
Who are we?

We're Capslock JA, a small company born from a group of young students in Pisa, Italy, willing to try mobile game development.

What is HardCade?

HardCade is our first official game, it's developed with HTML5 technologies and is carefully crafted pixel by pixel with a maniacal attention to details. It's inspired from the 16-bit platform games and from the earliest arcade games but it's using the modern one-tap approach without compromising the fun in gameplay!

Why this campaign?

We've decided to launch this campaign to gain feedback from people, and our objective is to reach 1000 USD to pay the various expenses that cover HardCade release costs: Application-Stores licenses, infrastructures, devices for testing, and sponsorship.

So, all the incomes will be re-invested in the release and future improvement of HardCade, new updates and new games in the future.

 

Obviously, we also thought about some rewards for the supporters (❤️️) that decide to help us in this journey:

 

  • 20$: A Secret-Design Capslock’s T-shirt!

  • 50$: Custom Advertisement Banner in our game FOREVER!

 

And don't forget to share this campaign!

Thank you and keep gaming!

story:
In the small community of Cookietown, dark secrets are baking beneath the sweet, innocent surface.  Fortunately, Brock Ollie and Callie Flower have opened up a new detective agency, CasaBrocka, dedicated to solving pastry-related crimes.  One night, Brock is working late when in walks a dame in red high heels.  Lilian Debbie's new case tastes like trouble for Callie and Brock's budding romance.  This Cookie wants them to find a missing secret recipe before the power hungry Pastry Mafia, known for their anti-sprinkle vendetta, gets its grubby mitts on it.

But all is not what it seems in the underworld of Cookietown.  The missing recipe is only the tip of the icing and this story has a dark creamy center that tastes like murder.  Brock and Callie soon discover that they have bitten off more than they can chew and need your help following the trail of cookie crumb clues before both town life and their relationship crumble. As a Cookietown Chronicles investigator, enroll other gumshoes in the adventure with you.  Sift your way through a maze of puzzles and character interactions to help the detectives catch the culprit in a zany world that evolves through your participation.

The Cookietown Chronicles is a grassroots Alternate Reality Game (ARG) series overseen by an international kitchen staff of writers, designers, puzzle specialists, and artists.  Alternate Reality Gaming is a powerful storytelling medium that places you within The Cookietown Chronicles mystery both to interact with characters and to influence the game world itself.  Follow the intrigue through an assortment of platforms, including websites, e-mail, and social media.  Combine the story ingredients and stir until the mixture is ready to bake.

 

Want some Cookietown Chronicles insider content and delectable swag?  Buy the ingredients for the first full-length episode.

Become a founding member of Cookietown Chronicles.  Finance the building of an interactive,  multidimensional digital portal to the world of Cookietown which will allow you and your network of family and friends to interact with characters, solve puzzles, and influence the evolution of the world of Cookietown. Your financial contributions will also support voice talent and other assets to enrich the experience.

No amount is too big or small.  So donate and sink your teeth into Cookietown today.

 

There are plenty of ways to help us write the recipe for Cookietown Chronicles's success:

  1. Gift a Taste of Cookietown
    Know someone who would think Cookietown Chronicles is sweet?  Let them know about it!  Tell your friends, family, and social groups (school, community, online) all about Cookietown.  If you have any media contacts that you think would want to do a story, please let them know about the game as well.
  2. Decorate Your Social Media Pages With Cookietown Links
    1. Visit The Cookietown Website
    2. "Like" Cookietown's Facebook Page
    3. "Tweet" About Cookietown
    4. Signup For The Cookietown Newsletter
    5. Create your own blog or website link.
  3. Invent Your Own Recipe
    Contact us if you want to get involved in your own unique way.

 

Lauren Soffer, the team leader, has been involved with the ARG community since 2008 under the pseudonym IneffaBelle.  After attending USC's film production program, she worked on Institute for the Future's game Ruby's Bequest and then worked with Jane McGonigal and The World Bank to facilitate the running of EVOKE, an educational game geared toward introducing social innovation to African youth.  She uses her background in creative storytelling to provide engaging content and dynamic leadership.

"As the lead creator behind the world of Cookietown, I'm excited to create a game that families can play together.  This innovative platform for storytelling is a way to bring players closer to each other by working as a team to solve the mysteries taking place in Cookietown. I also want to give back to the Alternative Reality Game community, which has been like a family to me.  I hope Cookietown will be a place to make friendships both with the characters and with the other players. I invite you to add your cup of sugar into the mixing bowl of Cookietown and help bake it into a wonderful experience for all!"

Pixie Kearsley has been involved in the ARG community since 2004, as a player and a moderator of the Unfiction forums. More recently, she joined the ARGFest planning committee. This is her first time as a Puppet Master (PM).

"After years of playing ARGs, becoming inspired by one very important man, and really wanting to get involved behind the scenes, a good friend took a chance on my writing skills and asked me to help expand her story world."

Joe Birdwell has been a ARG community member for several years.  He has created user generated content for several games, including the puzzles for Cookietown Chronicles. He recently had a submission selected in a Gameful Challenge for the creation of a Socks Inc Department.

"I feel that interactions and challenges in storyworlds need to feel organic, and the team has created such a rich storyworld that the interactions are planted in very fertile ground."

Phillip George holds degrees in both creative and professional writing. Aside from writing and reading, his interests include gaming and art. Cookietown Chronicles is the first Alternate Reality Game in which he has been involved.

"As a newcomer to ARGs, I'm excited to explore this medium and increase its prominence in the eyes of the general public. I'm a lifelong gamer and writer and appreciate both gaming and storytelling in its many forms. My primary hope is that people enjoy the game; beyond that, I'm hopeful that my contributions help bridge the gap between storytelling and gaming."

Owen Parish is new to the industry and hopes to get a good start.  He has experience writing Interactive Fiction and acting as a GM for tabletop roleplaying games. He is serving as a writer on this game.  He likes puzzles and stories and hopes to bring more examples of these things to everyone's attention.

"I will be with this game from the rise of the bread to the set of the meringue, through the heat of the oven and the cold of the fridge, in the hard times of the royal icing, and the soft times of the pastry."

Christina G. Smith, a freelance artist, was easily pulled into this world once she was told the story line and the creative freedom she would be given. This is the first time these characters have been drawn on paper, and she feels it was a great privilege to do that.  This is the first game, online or otherwise, she's worked on.  Her artistic contribution has brought the world of Cookietown to life.

"I want Cookietown to be a place for kids of all ages, a place where you can enjoy a town filled with characters and mysteries.  I've had the pleasure of  creating the world through images.  I hope my use of watercolors has made it so special that you will remember long after the game is over.  Good luck players!"

Samantha Lavoie is a fiction writer and a staff member of a creative writing group.  She has experience writing and designing for various websites.  Her hobbies include gaming, drawing, and graphic development.

"I'm a newcomer to ARGs.  I fell in love with them almost immediately. I've discovered that ARGs are great for all ages; they're fun and can provide a great learning experience. I was happy to write for one of the characters, and learn more about the ARG world. The experience has been fun, and certainly interesting. I'm hoping everyone can enjoy the wonderful story and have a great time puzzling out Cookietown."

Laura Hall has been an ARG player, forum moderator, and community manager since 2006, and a lover of storytelling, puzzles and mysteries all her life. This is her third time behind the curtain.

"I feel really lucky to have had a hand in bringing the world of Cookietown to life. There's a lot of texture for players to sink their teeth into, and some really fun (and funny) characters to meet. We've spent a lot of good times in Cookietown; now it's your turn."
