story:
In this side-scrolling Action RPG, you take the role of a World Eater which travels through The Void smashing and burrowing into unsuspecting worlds. There you can:

  • take control of a summoned Dragon which can be equipped and customized for maximum mayhem and destruction,
  • command minions to assassinate, pillage, spy and terraform,
  • defend against Settlement Armies, Thieves, Heroes and Slayers,
  • fight other dragons for supremacy and new abilities,
  • forge armors and abilities,
  • obliterate entire worlds on a whim,
  • and more....

Experience a dynamic world where Settlements react to Dragon presence by:

  • boosting each-other via Loot Caravans, 
  • scouting around for Loot that may have been dropped by Dragons,
  • summoning Armies and Heroes to steal from the Dragon's Lair,
  • summoning Dragon Slayers to hunt down Dragons.

Experience the randomness of a world where biomes and their settlements, settlement armies and their abilities, events and... pretty much everything related to the world will be randomized on every new game.

This game lets you mod just about anything from how everything looks to what everything uses to attack you with.

  • Steampunk Dragons? - no problem!
  • Units firing sheep as projectiles ? – done!
  • Biomes made of cake? - already there!


In this epic domination contest will you survive long enough to become Ruler of The Void?



This is the base game without any fancy depth of play

  • Your very own World Eater – complete with Dragon summoning rooms, Armor Forge, Ability Forge, Minion Dens,  customizable, upgradeable, able to travel through Void Portals and destroy worlds (batteries not included).
  • Your very own Dragons – Dragons, their abilities and armor - you name it, you can customize it.
  • Dynamic gameplay – Because dodging enemy attacks should be the norm.
  • Persistent metagame – What you build is yours to keep.
  • Persistent in-game rewards transferred to the metagame – You only need to earn them once,
  • Procedurally generated worlds - To infinity and beyond!
  • Summon minions to do your bidding – It’s not domination unless you command an endless horde of minions.
  • An extremely moddable and customizable framework – because the devs never know what the game is supposed to be like.

    For when a rampaging Dragon doesn't seem to work all that well...

    • Make minions more important by adding up to 12 sub-specializations for the Dragon's Lair.
    • Will increase the number of rooms available to build minions in.
    • Minions will gain new abilities.
    • Minions will be able to equip gear.
    • Modders will be able to fiddle around with the minions.

      Because not going out of your way to help those hobbits find their way to Isengard while everyone wants to kill you is inexcusable

      • we'll implement a challenge system that ties in with metagame rewards.
      • we'll create a pool of challenges that will get randomized on each new world.
      • modders will be able to fiddle around and create their own challenges.

        Domination Spree, Abyssal Storm or Meltdown are only a few of the epic sounding names describing equally epic game modes.

        • we'll implement a game mode system that ties in with metagame rewards.
        • these will offer various challenges that break away from the normal gameplay (see below).
        • modders will be able to fiddle around and create their own game mode variations.

          Achievements will reward excellence with more than “just a badge”,

          • we'll implement an achievement system that rewards players with useful and unique Armor Sets, Abilities and Dragons.
          • in a complete twist on game development you will have to actually Earn these unlike you would in most games...
          • These achievements will also be tied to Steam's system allowing you to rack up those points.

            Because what's the point of playing solo when you can dominate worlds with your friends in PvP or Team PvP,

            • we'll create the multiplayer mode allowing players to connect and play with each-other.
            • modders will be able to show off their stuff to other players.
            • we'll hire people to patch something up for this.
            • we'll make a multiplayer support department.

            For when casual slaughter isn't enough....
            • we'll build a competitive multiplayer platform.
            • we'll build a solid ranking system.
            • Dragons will gain the Shapeshifting ability allowing for a more stealthy approach when facing a more powerful opponent.
            • we'll build a Domination Engine that further empowers your Dragon's destructive abilities.
            • we'll build a solid matchmaking system for competitive play.
            • We’ll build an in-game trade market for Abilities, Dragon Cores Armor Blueprints and Materials.
            • we'll hire people that actually know what they're doing.
            • we'll hire more people in the support department that you can blame for random things.

              For who wants to enjoy the same experience on different devices

              • we'll start making versions for other platforms depending on demand. 



              This universe is populated by countless worlds teeming with life and a seemingly infinite biome variety.

              In what seems like an all you can eat buffet, space faring entities known only as World Eaters travel from planet to planet in order to devour resources and life force. They turn the life force into Domination Energy which they use to summon Dragons as their heralds of doom.

              These monumental creatures create their own twisted biome version which they’ll imprint on a planet on impact. As the host planet gets progressively terraformed so does the World Eater’s hold over the world’s resources and its core. Once the world becomes devoid of life and resources, the World Eater obliterates it before opening a Void Gate to its next meal.

              Although capable of unimaginable destruction, they’re vulnerable to the "insects" that inhabit the worlds. The Settlers will rush to a World Eater’s core to steal its life force which also happens to be a mountain of precious stones and metals. To protect themselves, the World Eaters collect Dragon Cores which they use to summon Dragons of different shapes, sizes and types.

              They will act as Lairs for the summoned Dragons using excess resources to build up a comfortable habitat for them, giving them access to Abilities, Armors and Minions and providing them with healing and transportation.

              When not on a world, Lairs will retreat in the Void where they can use stored Domination Energy to forge new Abilities and Armor for Dragons and fiddle with various settings of the Universe.



              Masters of shapeshifting, Dragons can infiltrate settlements and then can either steal valuable loot from the settlers to feed the Lair or morph back into their Dragon form and rise up from the middle of the settlement destroying structures in the process.

              Their mere presence terraforms the land to a draconic landscape disrupting a region’s income and their Call can command armies of minions to destroy or infiltrate settlements, overrun or assassinate enemies, build defenses, recover dropped treasures or permanently terraform regions.

              Dragons have access to various facilities that allow them to dominate worlds including the Armor Forge, Ability Forge and Domination Engine.

              • The Armor Forge will allow Dragons to fully customize their armor sets from how they look to what individual stats they have. The forged armors can be stored in the Abyssal Armory which will allow any Dragon to equip any available armor.
              • The Ability Forge will allow Dragons to discover new abilities, upgrade them or fuse them together for more powerful effects. Similar to the Abyssal Armory, they can be stored in the Abyssal Conflux which will allow any Dragon to use any available ability.
              • The Domination Engine will allow Dragons to create and customize their own Domination Essence - decaying power-ups that affect all available Dragons and their abilities. The Engine is powered by forged abilities whose levels affect the Domination Essence intensity.

              World Eaters can gain new Dragon Cores by defeating other World Eaters. Each Dragon having unique traits and visuals.



              Harvesting the Void’s sounds, World Eaters can create the Heavy Metal Dragon Core. Although they live in the Void, creating a Heavy Metal Dragon Core is not an easy task requiring a lot of Domination Energy.
              Few worlds have heard the song of the Void and fewer still have lived to tell the tale.


              It’s unknown where World Eaters go to find the Dragon Cores that spawn Clockwork Dragons. These are a World Eater’s pride and joy and no true Dragon Core collector would be seen without one.
              It is said that whenever attacking one of these Dragons time seems to slow down or even stop in their immediate vicinity making them nearly impossible to hit with normal projectiles.


              No Dragon is as elusive as the Steam Dragon and keeping one summoned is a World Eater’s way to boast about its seemingly endless supply of Domination Energy. Due to its ethereal nature, the Dragon’s shape can only be maintained using a highly pressurized metal body.
              Seemingly immortal, this Dragon can only be defeated by severely damaging its container, forcing the creature to dissipate.


              The local settlers are none too happy about their Dragon neighbors. In preparation for the encounter, they will start gathering resources, help each-other grow by sending Loot Caravans from one-another and will send Thieves to loot the nearby Dragon Lairs.

              Once their wealth allows it, they’ll be able to summon Hero Parties, Armies or even Dragon Slayers. The Thieves Guild will make its services available for the Settlers allowing them to send Thieves to stealthily steal from the Dragon’s Lair.

              • Hero Parties drawn by the sense of adventure, seeking fame and fortune or simply being forced into it by peer pressure, will warp onto the Dragon’s world in an attempt to loot or even slay the “World Eater”.
              • Armies are summoned forth by settlements to destroy the Dragon’s Lair and loot it. The army ranks are filled with all sorts of the oddities from the Greed Plane which will do anything for the promise of loot, even raiding a Dragon’s Lair.
              • Dragon Slayers are the ultimate combat summons which will actively seek out and hunt Dragons, empowering all Armies and Hero Parties in the process.

              The Dragon’s hoard size will attract more and more unwanted attention from Thieves, Hero Parties, Armies and Dragon Slayers.


              Occasionally players may find that other Dragons inhabit the same planet and they will have to use all their strength to defeat these foes; the prize being new abilities which they can upgrade to deal more damage and to have new effects added.

              The encounters will be fast paced and dynamic allowing dragons to use up to 4 types of abilities of 3 varying intensities with just a click of the mouse. The combat system favors and rewards good aim more than blind attack spam.

              Incoming attacks can either be avoided by quickly dashing out of the way or straight up tanked using a defensive ability or carefully crafted armor.

              Settlements will protect themselves using various abilities similar to a Dragon’s so players should be prepared for a world of hurt when deciding whether or not to attack a seemingly harmless village of laser cannon enthusiasts.

              Enemies that cannot defeat a Dragon will not engage in pointless fights, instead they’ll focus on stealing the dragon’s hoard faster. They will however be equipped with abilities which will severely cripple an overconfident Dragon.

              Stealing from the Dragons and giving to themselves, the Champions of Justice will relentlessly… rob Dragons blind every time they get the chance. They will be tough opponents bent on emptying the Dragon’s coffers as fast as they can. Wielding powerful abilities they’re not easy to defeat (for all the wrong reasons).

              Specialized Dragon Slayers will relentlessly hunt down Dragons using exotic abilities and their presence will boost the morale of all other enemies.



              After stumbling over a World Eater’s remains he went inside only to find a looted Dragon’s Lair. Searching to see if anything was left behind, he found a nearly perfect sphere made of rock near a runed pedestal. Grabbing the rock made it glow and almost instantly a portal opened up above and a giant World Clutcher claw came down pulling him into the Void of the World Eaters.
              Story goes that the same kind of portal opens every time the world is threatened by World Eaters. A creature made of Domination Energy emerges from the portal bearing a World Clutcher claw for an arm and relentlessly chases down the Dragons killing them with strange magic and stealing their energy.




              The search for knowledge and the truth of his world led him into the depths of a dead World Eater. Even after hundreds of years since the World Eater’s demise, Domination Energy filled the air making a dense poisonous fog. Denser still was the fog around the now empty hoard chamber in which the gold used to reside. The goal of this intrusion however wasn’t the fortune but the countless runes that seemed to be on every wall. One wall in particular stood out which seemed to have runes glow whenever a bag of gold was nearby.

              Eons passed since discovering the wall’s secret and Jar’Edo is still alive showing up whenever a World Eater appears. Using his knowledge of the Void he hunts down Dragons to feed his books and to quench his endless thirst of knowledge and power.


              Occasional Mysterious Traders will appear offering resources, abilities and a safe haven for Dragons. Settlements however strongly believe that Dragon Traders ruin the neighborhood and they will dispatch punitive forces to swiftly deal with the undesirables.

              Settlements will send Caravans to boost each-other’s economy or to save their fortune in case they’re facing certain doom.

              Random Encounters will have Dragons engage in various challenge events.


              World Eaters can choose to change planets at any time destroying the current one in the process. Each new planetary impact will result in the seamless procedural generation of a whole world.

              World Eaters get to choose their next collision course influencing what planet they’re going to hit on their next milestone:

              • Tame World – a small world where wounded World Eaters can feed off to regain some of the lost hoard.
              • Balanced World – a medium-sized world where players can find moderate challenge and a moderate supply of loot to increase their Dragon’s hoard.
              • Raging World – a large world where players get to fend off powerful armies and conquer large settlements to gain ability experience, armor materials and hoard.
              • Dragon World – players get to fight NPC Dragons to gain new abilities.
              • Nemesis World - multiplayer vs battle.

              Planet collisions will not affect the Lair – carrying over any and all changes made to it. It will however kill the minions.



              Each time World Eaters land on a planet, a random list of Dynamic Challenges will be given, which Dragons have to go out of their way to complete. Challenges will offer various rewards which range from Domination Energy to Armor Set pieces and blueprints.

              • Take the Hobbits to Isengard - even after all this time Hobbits need be taken to Isengard...
              • Zombie Plants vs Dragons- when a Necroplanter starts raising undead plants, only a Dragon can root out this evil (it's pretty corny we know...)
              • Eat the Cloudtart - some clouds are just begging to be eaten. Catching this fast food will be a challenge however...

              Game modes feature some fast paced worlds with different rule sets. Each game mode will offer increasingly better rewards as the players advance through the game.
              • Domination Spree – is a mode in which the Dragons have to destroy small worlds increasingly faster to satiate the Lair’s hunger.
              • Abyssal Storm – is a mode in which Lair Seeds will constantly fall from the sky replacing defeated Lairs creating a proving ground.
              • Meltdown – is a mode in which the world’s volcanos are unstable creating dangerous fire rains all around the planet.
              • And more…





                Everyone on the team is excited to see a dynamic game where you can directly control a Dragon and break worlds asunder as opposed to playing a game where you just “have a Dragon in it” or even worse “it’s part of the backstory”. On top of that we also wanted to create a unique universe where the Lair itself is alive and where Dragons can be pretty much anything you imagined them to be (Steampunk Dragons, Heavy Metal Rock Dragons, Sheep Dragons, you name it) and can use about any attack you can think of (lasers, rockets, fireballs, whatever you want really…) So far we’re proud of how flexible the game’s modding system turned out.

                Unfortunately creating worlds takes a huge financial effort. Although our initial backers valiantly supported the first stage of development, the wads of cash needed to fuel the project can’t be reached without outside support.

                If you want to see an awesome game like this out there and want to support a company that will build loads of similarly unique games in the future, this is where it all starts.


                We need to raise enough cash to fund our experienced team to do this proper. Although only a handful of projects dared to ask for this much on Indiegogo we’re doing so with the knowledge that we aren’t only making a game but a whole universe and a platform for modders to go wild in the Action RPG genre. This means we’re building a whole new Action RPG system pretty much from scratch which has to be flexible enough to support loads of content (both official releases and modded) while maintaining its overall scope and feel (Dragon brawl mayhem).

                A large portion of the features we’ve talked about on this page have already been implemented and are working at code level but we need funding if we are to actually use that code and build something fun and playable around it.

                We’ve already taken into account the possibility that we can’t gather the whole sum needed to hit all our funding goals so we’ve made them fairly flexible in nature allowing us to prioritize some before others in case you guys feel something requires more urgency.

                Your votes will matter in the development process and will visibly impact what we’re touching on in each sprint so your money will be spent on the features you want most.






                We are an international team of veterans that hail from Ubisoft, EA, Namco, Sega and Sierra. We worked on project-relevant titles like Crash Bandicoot series, The Legend of Spyro series, Soul Calibur series and a bunch of other games from which our experience may or may not come in handy such as Final Fantasy series, Crystal Defenders, Puzzle Quest 2, Rolling with Katamari, The Incredible Machine, Delta Force, Bourne Conspiracy, Silent Hunter series, Chess Master series, Medal of Honor, Red Alert, and more…








                Unexpected Delays - these are pretty much the norm in game development. Fortunately in our 10+ year history we’ve created and shipped more than 20 games on four different platforms so we have a pretty good grasp on how long it takes to build a game of this magnitude.

                Even though we took into account building most of the main features, as their number grows so will the chance something goes wrong. We will however provide you with milestone iterations which will ensure you have the latest most polished content even after the release of the base package.

                Besides, if any delays show up we can always slow down time around us so everyone looking thinks we're working faster right ? RIGHT?

                Feature Creep - it’s a real challenge keeping this game on a manageable scale especially since we want this project to have so much depth. For this reason, the community will be the one voting on features and content via a tiered forum system. Since this game is so player-centric we want the very best gameplay experience and only players can tell us what they want their Dragons to feel like.

                The game features will be presented to backers as early as their concept state. If a Cotton Candy Dragon that attacks using rainbow chairs ends up in the game it’s all your fault! (the poptart cat laser, albeit a tad buggy, was pretty fun when we tried it).

                Community Content Distribution - we need to build a community content sharing system that allows players to exchange mods in a solid content management environment. This will require a separate set of expenses and it’s related to the company itself rather than the game. We have some idea as of how we’ll manage this but we’re still searching for some cheaper alternatives that allow our modders the freedom they deserve.

                World Eater Landing - we need to build a few more telescopes specialized in scouting the Void for incoming World Eaters. If even one of them manages to land of Earth, it’s pretty much the end of this project.



                Spread the word:

                • Nag your friends with it,
                • Nag your Facebook “friends” with it
                • Blog about it
                • Vine it,
                • Snapchat it,
                • Slap our banner on your car
                • Slap our banner on your neighbour’s car
                • Slap our banner on a stranger’s car
                • Sing about our campaign in your rock concerts
                • Tweet it to Martin Freeman.
                • Tweet it to Emilia Clarke.

                If all else fails... Ask Bill Gates to donate for a good cause.
story_txt:
In this side-scrolling Action RPG, you take the role of a World Eater which
travels through The Void smashing and burrowing into unsuspecting worlds. There
you can: 

take control of a summoned Dragon which can be equipped and
     customized for maximum mayhem and destruction, 
command minions to assassinate, pillage, spy and terraform, 
defend against Settlement Armies, Thieves, Heroes and Slayers,
fight other dragons for supremacy and new abilities,
forge armors and abilities,
obliterate entire worlds on a whim,
and more....

Experience a dynamic world where Settlements react to Dragon presence by: 

boosting each-other via Loot Caravans, 
scouting around for Loot that may have been dropped by Dragons,
summoning Armies and Heroes to steal from the Dragon's Lair,
summoning Dragon Slayers to hunt down Dragons.

Experience the randomness of a world where biomes and their settlements,
settlement armies and their abilities, events and... pretty much everything
related to the world will be randomized on every new game.
This game lets you mod just about anything from how everything looks to what
everything uses to attack you with. 

Steampunk Dragons? - no problem!
Units firing sheep as projectiles ? – done!
Biomes made of cake? - already there!


In this epic domination contest will you survive long enough to become Ruler of
The Void? 




This is the base game without any fancy depth of play


Your very own World Eater – complete with Dragon
     summoning rooms, Armor Forge, Ability Forge, Minion Dens, 
     customizable, upgradeable, able to travel through Void Portals and destroy
     worlds (batteries not included).

Your very own Dragons – Dragons, their abilities and
     armor - you name it, you can customize it.

Dynamic gameplay – Because dodging enemy attacks should
     be the norm.

Persistent metagame – What you build is yours to keep.

Persistent in-game rewards transferred to the metagame –
     You only need to earn them once,

Procedurally generated worlds - To infinity and beyond!

Summon minions to do your bidding – It’s not domination
     unless you command an endless horde of minions.

An extremely moddable and customizable framework –
     because the devs never know what the game is supposed to be like.






For when a rampaging Dragon doesn't seem to work all that
well... 

Make minions more important by adding up to 12
     sub-specializations for the Dragon's Lair.
Will increase the number of rooms available to build minions
     in.
Minions will gain new abilities.
Minions will be able to equip gear.
Modders will be able to fiddle around with the minions.






Because not going out of your way to help those hobbits find
their way to Isengard while everyone wants to kill you is inexcusable 

we'll implement a challenge system that ties in with metagame
     rewards.
we'll create a pool of challenges that will get randomized on
     each new world.
modders will be able to fiddle around and create their own
     challenges.








Domination Spree, Abyssal Storm or Meltdown are only a few of the epic
sounding names describing equally epic game modes.

we'll implement a game mode system that ties in with metagame
     rewards.
these will offer various challenges that break away from the
     normal gameplay (see below).
modders will be able to fiddle around and create their own game
     mode variations.








Achievements will reward excellence with more than “just a badge”,

we'll implement an achievement system that rewards players with
     useful and unique Armor Sets, Abilities and Dragons.
in a complete twist on game development you will have to
     actually Earn these unlike you would in most games...
These achievements will also be tied to Steam's system allowing
     you to rack up those points.








Because what's the point of playing solo when you can dominate worlds with
your friends in PvP or Team PvP,

we'll create the multiplayer mode allowing players to connect
     and play with each-other.
modders will be able to show off their stuff to other players.
we'll hire people to patch something up for this.
we'll make a multiplayer support department.



For when casual slaughter isn't enough.... 


we'll build a competitive multiplayer platform.
we'll build a solid ranking system.
Dragons will gain the Shapeshifting ability allowing for a more
     stealthy approach when facing a more powerful opponent.
we'll build a Domination Engine that further empowers your
     Dragon's destructive abilities.
we'll build a solid matchmaking system for competitive play.
We’ll build an in-game trade market for Abilities, Dragon Cores
     Armor Blueprints and Materials.
we'll hire people that actually know what they're doing.
we'll hire more people in the support department that you can
     blame for random things.








For who wants to enjoy the same experience on different devices
we'll start making versions for other platforms depending on
     demand.  



This universe is populated by countless worlds teeming with life and a
seemingly infinite biome variety. 
In what seems like an all you can eat buffet, space faring entities known
only as World Eaters travel from planet to planet in order to devour resources
and life force. They turn the life force into Domination Energy which they use
to summon Dragons as their heralds of doom. 
These monumental creatures create their own twisted biome version which
they’ll imprint on a planet on impact. As the host planet gets progressively
terraformed so does the World Eater’s hold over the world’s resources and its
core. Once the world becomes devoid of life and resources, the World Eater
obliterates it before opening a Void Gate to its next meal.
Although capable of unimaginable destruction, they’re vulnerable to the
"insects" that inhabit the worlds. The Settlers will rush to a World Eater’s core
to steal its life force which also happens to be a mountain of precious stones
and metals. To protect themselves, the World Eaters collect Dragon Cores which
they use to summon Dragons of different shapes, sizes and types.
They will act as Lairs for the summoned Dragons using excess resources to
build up a comfortable habitat for them, giving them access to Abilities,
Armors and Minions and providing them with healing and transportation.
When not on a world, Lairs will retreat in the Void where they can use
stored Domination Energy to forge new Abilities and Armor for Dragons and
fiddle with various settings of the Universe.




Masters of shapeshifting, Dragons can infiltrate settlements
and then can either steal valuable loot from the settlers to feed the Lair or
morph back into their Dragon form and rise up from the middle of the settlement
destroying structures in the process. 

Their mere presence terraforms the land to a draconic landscape disrupting a
region’s income and their Call can command armies of minions to destroy or
infiltrate settlements, overrun or assassinate enemies, build defenses, recover
dropped treasures or permanently terraform regions.
Dragons have access to various facilities that allow them to dominate worlds
including the Armor Forge, Ability Forge and Domination Engine.


The Armor Forge will allow Dragons to fully customize
     their armor sets from how they look to what individual stats they have.
     The forged armors can be stored in the Abyssal Armory which will
     allow any Dragon to equip any available armor.

The Ability Forge will allow Dragons to discover new
     abilities, upgrade them or fuse them together for more powerful effects.
     Similar to the Abyssal Armory, they can be stored in the Abyssal
     Conflux which will allow any Dragon to use any available ability.

The Domination Engine will allow Dragons to
     create and customize their own Domination Essence - decaying
     power-ups that affect all available Dragons and their abilities. The
     Engine is powered by forged abilities whose levels affect the Domination Essence
     intensity.

World Eaters can gain new Dragon Cores by defeating other World Eaters. Each
Dragon having unique traits and visuals.





Harvesting the Void’s sounds, World Eaters can create the 
Heavy Metal Dragon Core. Although they live in the Void, creating a 
Heavy Metal Dragon Core is not an easy task requiring a lot of 
Domination Energy. Few worlds have heard the song of the Void and fewer still have lived to tell the tale.

It’s unknown where World Eaters go to find the Dragon Cores that spawn 
Clockwork Dragons. These are a World Eater’s pride and joy and no true 
Dragon Core collector would be seen without one.
								It is said that whenever attacking one of these Dragons time 
seems to slow down or even stop in their immediate vicinity making them 
nearly impossible to hit with normal projectiles. 


No Dragon is as elusive as the Steam Dragon and keeping one summoned is a
 World Eater’s way to boast about its seemingly endless supply of 
Domination Energy. Due to its ethereal nature, the Dragon’s shape can 
only be maintained using a highly pressurized metal body.
								
Seemingly immortal, this Dragon can only be defeated by severely damaging its container, forcing the creature to dissipate.

The local settlers are none too happy about their Dragon
neighbors. In preparation for the encounter, they will start gathering
resources, help each-other grow by sending Loot Caravans from
one-another and will send Thieves to loot the nearby Dragon Lairs. 

Once their wealth allows it, they’ll be able to summon Hero Parties, Armies
or even Dragon Slayers. The Thieves Guild will make its services
available for the Settlers allowing them to send Thieves to stealthily
steal from the Dragon’s Lair.


Hero Parties drawn by the sense of adventure,
     seeking fame and fortune or simply being forced into it by peer pressure,
     will warp onto the Dragon’s world in an attempt to loot or even slay the
     “World Eater”.

Armies are summoned forth by settlements to destroy the
     Dragon’s Lair and loot it. The army ranks are filled with all sorts of the
     oddities from the Greed Plane which will do anything for the promise of
     loot, even raiding a Dragon’s Lair.

Dragon Slayers are the ultimate combat summons which
     will actively seek out and hunt Dragons, empowering all Armies and Hero
     Parties in the process.

The Dragon’s hoard size will attract more and more unwanted attention from
Thieves, Hero Parties, Armies and Dragon Slayers. 



Occasionally players may find that other Dragons inhabit the same planet and
they will have to use all their strength to defeat these foes; the prize being
new abilities which they can upgrade to deal more damage and to have new
effects added. 

The encounters will be fast paced and dynamic allowing dragons to use up to
4 types of abilities of 3 varying intensities with just a click of the mouse.
The combat system favors and rewards good aim more than blind attack spam.
Incoming attacks can either be avoided by quickly dashing out of the way or
straight up tanked using a defensive ability or carefully crafted armor.
Settlements will protect themselves using various abilities similar to a
Dragon’s so players should be prepared for a world of hurt when deciding
whether or not to attack a seemingly harmless village of laser cannon
enthusiasts.
Enemies that cannot defeat a Dragon will not engage in pointless fights,
instead they’ll focus on stealing the dragon’s hoard faster. They will however
be equipped with abilities which will severely cripple an overconfident Dragon.
Stealing from the Dragons and giving to themselves, the Champions of
Justice will relentlessly… rob Dragons blind every time they get the
chance. They will be tough opponents bent on emptying the Dragon’s coffers as
fast as they can. Wielding powerful abilities they’re not easy to defeat (for
all the wrong reasons).
Specialized Dragon Slayers will relentlessly hunt down Dragons using
exotic abilities and their presence will boost the morale of all other enemies.







After stumbling over a World Eater’s remains he went inside only to find
 a looted Dragon’s Lair. Searching to see if anything was left behind, 
he found a nearly perfect sphere made of rock near a runed pedestal. 
Grabbing the rock made it glow and almost instantly a portal opened up 
above and a giant World Clutcher claw came down pulling him into the 
Void of the World Eaters. 
									Story goes that the same kind of portal opens every time the world is 
threatened by World Eaters. A creature made of Domination Energy emerges
 from the portal bearing a World Clutcher claw for an arm and 
relentlessly chases down the Dragons killing them with strange magic and
 stealing their energy.




The search for knowledge and the truth of his world led him into the 
depths of a dead World Eater. Even after hundreds of years since the 
World Eater’s demise, Domination Energy filled the air making a dense 
poisonous fog. Denser still was the fog around the now empty hoard 
chamber in which the gold used to reside. The goal of this intrusion 
however wasn’t the fortune but the countless runes that seemed to be on 
every wall. One wall in particular stood out which seemed to have runes 
glow whenever a bag of gold was nearby.
									Eons passed since discovering the wall’s secret and Jar’Edo is still 
alive showing up whenever a World Eater appears. Using his knowledge of 
the Void he hunts down Dragons to feed his books and to quench his 
endless thirst of knowledge and power.


Occasional Mysterious Traders will appear offering resources,
abilities and a safe haven for Dragons. Settlements however strongly believe
that Dragon Traders ruin the neighborhood and they will dispatch punitive
forces to swiftly deal with the undesirables.

Settlements will send Caravans to boost each-other’s economy or to
save their fortune in case they’re facing certain doom.
Random Encounters will have Dragons engage in various challenge
events.




World Eaters can choose to change planets at any time destroying the current
one in the process. Each new planetary impact will result in the seamless
procedural generation of a whole world.

World Eaters get to choose their next collision course influencing what
planet they’re going to hit on their next milestone:


Tame World – a small world where wounded World Eaters
     can feed off to regain some of the lost hoard.

Balanced World – a medium-sized world where players can
     find moderate challenge and a moderate supply of loot to increase their
     Dragon’s hoard.

Raging World – a large world where players get to fend
     off powerful armies and conquer large settlements to gain ability
     experience, armor materials and hoard.

Dragon World – players get to fight NPC Dragons to gain
     new abilities.

Nemesis World - multiplayer vs battle.

Planet collisions will not affect the Lair – carrying over any and all
changes made to it. It will however kill the minions.






Each time World Eaters land on a planet, a random list of Dynamic Challenges
will be given, which Dragons have to go out of their way to complete.
Challenges will offer various rewards which range from Domination Energy to
Armor Set pieces and blueprints.


Take the Hobbits to Isengard - even after all this time
     Hobbits need be taken to Isengard...

Zombie Plants vs Dragons- when a Necroplanter starts
     raising undead plants, only a Dragon can root out this evil (it's pretty
     corny we know...)

Eat the Cloudtart - some clouds are just begging to be
     eaten. Catching this fast food will be a challenge however...

Game modes feature some fast paced worlds with different
rule sets. Each game mode will offer increasingly better rewards as the players
advance through the game. 



Domination Spree – is a mode in which the Dragons have
     to destroy small worlds increasingly faster to satiate the Lair’s hunger.

Abyssal Storm – is a mode in which Lair Seeds will
     constantly fall from the sky replacing defeated Lairs creating a proving
     ground.

Meltdown – is a mode in which the world’s volcanos are
     unstable creating dangerous fire rains all around the planet.
And more…







Everyone on the team is excited to see a dynamic game where you can directly
control a Dragon and break worlds asunder as opposed to playing a game where
you just “have a Dragon in it” or even worse “it’s part of the backstory”. On
top of that we also wanted to create a unique universe where the Lair itself is
alive and where Dragons can be pretty much anything you imagined them to be
(Steampunk Dragons, Heavy Metal Rock Dragons, Sheep Dragons, you name it) and
can use about any attack you can think of (lasers, rockets, fireballs, whatever
you want really…) So far we’re proud of how flexible the game’s modding system
turned out.


Unfortunately creating worlds takes a huge financial effort. Although our initial
backers valiantly supported the first stage of development, the wads of cash
needed to fuel the project can’t be reached without outside support.
If you want to see an awesome game like this out there and want to support a
company that will build loads of similarly unique games in the future, this is
where it all starts.




We need to raise enough cash to fund our experienced team to
do this proper. Although only a handful of projects dared to ask for this much
on Indiegogo we’re doing so with the knowledge that we aren’t only making a
game but a whole universe and a platform for modders to go wild in the Action
RPG genre. This means we’re building a whole new Action RPG system pretty much
from scratch which has to be flexible enough to support loads of content (both
official releases and modded) while maintaining its overall scope and feel (Dragon brawl mayhem).
A large portion of the features we’ve talked about on this
page have already been implemented and are working at code level but we need
funding if we are to actually use that code and build something fun and
playable around it.
We’ve already taken into account the possibility that we
can’t gather the whole sum needed to hit all our funding goals so we’ve made
them fairly flexible in nature allowing us to prioritize some before others in
case you guys feel something requires more urgency.
Your votes will matter in the development process and will
visibly impact what we’re touching on in each sprint so your money will be
spent on the features you want most.




We are an international team of veterans that hail from
Ubisoft, EA, Namco, Sega and Sierra. We worked on project-relevant titles like Crash Bandicoot series, The Legend of Spyro series, Soul Calibur
series and a bunch of other games from which our experience may or may not come
in handy such as Final Fantasy series,
Crystal Defenders, Puzzle Quest 2, Rolling with Katamari, The
Incredible Machine, Delta Force,
Bourne Conspiracy, Silent Hunter series,
Chess Master series, Medal of Honor, Red Alert, and more…














Unexpected Delays - these are pretty much the norm in game
development. Fortunately in our 10+ year history we’ve created and shipped more
than 20 games on four different platforms so we have a pretty good grasp on how
long it takes to build a game of this magnitude. 
Even though we took into account building most of the main features, as
their number grows so will the chance something goes wrong. We will however
provide you with milestone iterations which will ensure you have the latest
most polished content even after the release of the base package.
Besides, if any delays show up we can always slow down time around us so
everyone looking thinks we're working faster right ? RIGHT?
Feature Creep - it’s a real challenge keeping this game on a
manageable scale especially since we want this project to have so much depth.
For this reason, the community will be the one voting on features and content
via a tiered forum system. Since this game is so player-centric we want the
very best gameplay experience and only players can tell us what they want their
Dragons to feel like.
The game features will be presented to backers as early as their concept
state. If a Cotton Candy Dragon that attacks using rainbow chairs ends up in
the game it’s all your fault! (the poptart cat laser, albeit a tad buggy, was
pretty fun when we tried it).
Community Content Distribution - we need to build a community content
sharing system that allows players to exchange mods in a solid content
management environment. This will require a separate set of expenses and it’s
related to the company itself rather than the game. We have some idea as of how
we’ll manage this but we’re still searching for some cheaper alternatives that
allow our modders the freedom they deserve.
World Eater Landing - we need to build a few more telescopes
specialized in scouting the Void for incoming World Eaters. If even one of them
manages to land of Earth, it’s pretty much the end of this project.



Spread the word:




Nag your friends with it,

Nag your Facebook “friends” with it





Blog about it

Vine it,

Snapchat it,



Slap our banner on your car

Slap our banner on your neighbour’s car

Slap our banner on a stranger’s car



Sing about our campaign in your rock concerts

Tweet it to Martin Freeman. 

Tweet it to Emilia Clarke.

If all else fails... Ask Bill Gates to donate for a good cause.

story:
Short Summary

I am Alex Greentown and I am creating the new kind of adventure. Inspired by Hayao Miyazaki movies and amazing personages I decided to go farther and create a whole new world. I am writing the music and making the design for this game. Also I am making all the modelling, animation and programming.

In this adventure you will meet amazing personages, stunning environments, blue mountains, pink river, white forest, you will ride the blue antelope and the golden dragon. I made alpha version of the game and its just the beginning!

You can play the alpha version at https://apps.facebook.com/new_adventure/

If you like the game then pledge a dollar or more and share this page with your friend.

Blue cave, white forest, pink waterfall

In demo I made the first stage - blue cave. Outside the cave you can see a part of white forest. Now my goal is to make the entire white forest, pink waterfall and add 5 personages. For this I need 800$. If you pledge now you will get special gifts and special items. And their cost now is 2 times lower than after game release!

In this adventure you will collect pearls, search gems, defense against enemies, travel in amazing places, meet new friends and solve puzzles. If you join now you will get awesome bonuses to use them in game or gift to your friends! Here are the perks:

Everyone who buy 10$ or more will get special gifts ! You are going to like it !

The new kind of adventure

Entire game has 10 locations and my next goal is to get money for all stages which are:

Next goals:

  • Blue cave is already done but needs polished
  • 800$ White forest and Pink waterfall
  • 1500$ Rainy tableland
  • 2000$ The green village
  • 2500$ The pit
  • 3000$ Subterranean treasure
  • 3500$ Amethyst canyon
  • 4000$ Outer lands
  • 5000$ Lake of joy
All this also includes lots of amazing personages, also ambient music and animated story cut scenes. Lets build this world together!

Pledge few dollars and share this with your friends!

story:
Ready for a challenge!

Hello!
My name is Bob and this is my first Indiegogo project.  I live in beautiful Montana where i was born and raised. 
This is my first game and I'm looking to release this year. I've been working on this project any spare chance that i get. 
Even though the game is nearly finished I've run into a minor speed bump. I used GameMaker: Studio to learn coding and build this game. However to export to Android, or IOs, requires buying additional parts of the program. 
With your help I am looking to purchase the GameMaker: Studio Exports and publish it (free with ads) not only for Android but also for Apple and Tizen(Samsung). 
I would like to raise $800 to purchase the GameMaker: Studio Master Collection.
Of course this is just the beginning. The first game of many to come. Help me achieve my goal and please share this with friends and family.

story:
|| IMPORTANT ||

Rift's Cave is now available on Steam Early Access


 http://store.steampowered.com/app/335210


Thanks everybody and continue to help us!



*ALL the pics are taken directly from the game.

About my Self

I'm studying Computer Programming at University, and i love making innovative things with technology / i'd love to make something great and innovative with PC.

I believe in the latest technologies but I trust even more in the Future of technology, especially about Computers and Virtual Reality.

My name is Andrea Marinelli,the developer of Rift's Cave!

The Question is simple.

"Why have you created a campaign and why is this important to you?"

Because i need your help to make a very unforgettable game experience.

Oculus Rift is a Virtual Reality headset that is going to change the world forever. I want use this kind of Technology to make a very innovative experience. But to do that, i need to buy the license for the Engine and programs i'm using at the moment to build the game!


I LOVE work on this project and i love much more can complete the game in the next future,i really want share this magical experience with everybody.

This game will be playable from anyone, your grandma will probably love it too!And this beatiful sunset below is just a little proof:



Game Description

Rift's Cave is an Adventure/exploration game. You will be able to see every angle of the environment around you like if you are in there.This time the most important different between all exploration/adventure game is the world designed specifically for Oculus Rift. With this VR HeadSet you will be able to see around you with your eyes and Rift's cave exploit all the potential of Oculus Rift to give you the more beatiful atmosphere to see.


But Rift's cave isn't only this! You will be able also to get in your Inventory some artifacts,items, you will pick up some documents simply to read them and found out some other things about the story,if you are in dark places you can turn on your torch or your magical stuff to read,you'll be able to use powerful magical abilities to fight and defend yourself,or just to solve some puzzles on the way.



You will have to find the right way(if there are only one!) to go forward in the game,hidden doors,surprises everywhere,dangerous places can change around you everytime!


Are you ready to found out the story of Rift's Cave? Why you are alone in a magical cave? Who are you? We'll found out togheter soon!


Why We need your help!

Let us open the door to more interesting things!


We absolutely need your help because we are all students and we don't have a lot of money to support the making of the game, and this is the only chance that we have to make our dream possible.We'll use the money to funds the game to buy some things from the Assets Store,The license of the Engine,The license for music tracks,voice modifier program, and probabily some other external programs if we'll need to use some other.


Like I've said this game is going to be one of the first complete adventure/exploration game for the Oculus Rift and can be really customizable! It depends from your interest about the project.More funds you can donate to us,more customizable option you'll have. You will be able to change your special suits,your weapons/torch/light,and  you will be able to play a special exclusive map only for you!


If we'll don't reach the goal we haven't any intention to use the money for other things.We need all the money possible to make more epic game but if we can't reach the goal there will be really difficult to continue the project,so please help us!Every Dollars will use to buy something usefull to the game.

On the Official Oculus Rift forum

[https://developer.oculusvr.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=42&t=5375&sid=c1629991f107cbb136a9af64a555aa65]

you can find a Free Demo playable,this is a little proof of our hard work!


What we want to make and what we have!


Like I've said before,for contributor is really important to donate us if they love some customizable option,graphics,items,ENTIRE maps,some special ability,soundtrack and so much other things!. All this kind of stuff would be available to all people want fund the project.

Games like this will be probabily militestone for Oculus Rift and this kind of game are going to be the game with more impact in the Virtual Reality world. The most exciting thing to see in virtual world,before to FPS games,before to Horror games,before to Simulation games, is the BEATIFUL places can be created in VR(Virtual Reality).The most beatiful places in games are in exploration and adventure games,because a lot of attention of details is dedicated to the environment.And how beatiful can be to see something with your eyes inside the Oculus rift,when the environment and places are REALLY well done? Oh well..you have only to discover it!

Like we have said before,the game is not only an ideas,we have a Demo available on the Official forum of Oculus

*DEMO DOWNLOAD: https://developer.oculusvr.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=42&t=5375&sid=c1629991f107cbb136a9af64a555aa65 [Latest version v2.5]

*We suggest you to play with Keyboard+Mouse,the Gamepad is not already full integrated but it's at the top of our "List of things to do".

All screenshot below were captured in game:


INTERACTIVE GRAPHIC USER INTERFACE



Official Share Section of Oculus Rift:https://share.oculus.com/app/rifts-cave-full-game


If you appreciate our campaign,our demo and our ideas and you want help us and share our dream you can also share this campaign wherever you want,on forums,website,personal web spaces,facebook etc.

Especially if you can't contribute for some other problems but you have also some interest in our project,please share the campaign! 


Thanks a lot!

story:
RF Systems
My name is Ron and I am a one man team working on my first ever mobile game for Android and iOS! I have always been interested in mobile game design, the first game I ever made was for the TI-83 graphing calculator it was a star trek game to be played just by me. If this game gets funding I would love to make Space Journey RF 2 and others. I already have another alpha project in the works.
Space Journey RF is a text based space adventure for Android and iOS. You are a star ship captain trying to get to Messier 83, a new planet that was found to be an exact replica of Earth. All countries are trying to get there and take claim. Earth cannot sustain is population! Something must be done soon.

 Features:

- Over 100+ Diffrent encounters

- Gain experience to upgrade your ship

- Each playthough is diffrent!

 

Where funding will go:
Eighty percent of the funding is going to go to a new laptop and mobile devices to finish the game and develop future projects. Right now I am using a very old Pentium M laptop and a HTC One V android phone. I would like to buy a high end Android device such as a Galaxy S3/4 or a HTC One to be able to make sure the game runs and looks good on high end devices. I am also looking at buying a Lenovo Yoga 13 laptop so I can develop faster and longer I love to add new features or upload videos to YouTube but my current pc is too slow.
The other twenty percent of the funds will go to software needed to continue development. Tools such as Photoshop and filter forge are required. I have been using free versions and trials up until now.
The game is ninety percent done, all I am doing now is adding encounters and making sure it balanced and fun.
This is my hobby, I am doing this for fun. I am one person making some fun game for people to play. After this first effort there will be many more games to come!
Please feel free to visit my website www.rfsystems.ca for screenshots and info!
If you can't contribute no problem! You can still help by spreading the word and generating buzz.

 

New updated video with sound added!

story:
Who are we?

We're a group of video game developers located in beautiful Orlando, Florida.  Members of our team have degrees in Business Administration, Digital Media, and Information Technology, as well as Master's degrees in Interactive Entertainment from the University of Central Florida. We've had experience working in the industry as part of a larger company, but the lack of quality Christian-themed games has inspired us to step up to the plate.


Where can you find us?

We're trying to build a strong Internet presence with many different ways for you to find us. So, naturally we turned to social networking.  We can be found on Facebook, Google Plus, and Twitter, and will be updating our pages as often as possible.  Bear with us if we're a tad slow, we all have other full-time jobs at the moment!  A quick search for Cohort Media on any of those sites should find us, So look us up and drop us a line.


We also have a standard website with a bit more information about us.  You can find it at http://www.cohortmedia.com


What are we going to do?

Our plan is to provide Christian-themed games for a variety of platforms and audiences. Hundreds of millions of people are playing games on their phones, on Facebook, and on their computers, but the vast majority of games have nothing to do with Christianity.  Now, don't get us wrong.  We love video games as they are now, but we'd like for there to be fun, polished, Christian alternatives to be enjoyed.  There are 2 main audiences we'd like the opportunity to target:  Christian families with children and those who have not yet found a relationship with Christ.


Anytime you go to a restaurant (or maybe even church!), you'll see children playing games on their parents' cell phones.  This "restaurant effect" provides a terrific opportunity for children to learn more about Christ and his teachings, while enjoying an entertaining game that parents know is safe for their age.  Children are inquisitive, and we'd love them to be asking their families about Noah and his ark instead of which gun deals the most damage.  To that end, we'd also include a special "Parent's Corner" with all our children's games, giving parents some insight on what we're teaching, where they can find it in the Bible, and some hints about the game (after all, you need to be able to show your kids how to play!)


Our second audience, the non-Christian, is a bit trickier to reach but just as important, if not more important.  There are plenty of reasons why someone may not be a Christian, and we understand that. But a few of those reasons can be helped.  Let's face it, going to a church for the first time can be intimidating.  You're in a room filled with people you may not know, talking about stories you've never heard, and you don't know the words to any of the songs.  Even opening the Bible for the first time is a daunting experience, and enough to overwhelm some. With video games, we're able to present all the great stories of the Bible in a low stress, familiar environment, and in a format that many people are comfortable with.  Our goal is to reduce the barriers to entry for those non-Christians, and open the doors in a way that they can learn and grow without feeling overwhelmed.


Who are we going to impact?

As of October 2011, over 250 million iOS devices (iPhones, iPod Touches, and iPads) have been sold worldwide.  Similarly, over 180 million Android devices have been sold, with another 700,000 being activated every day.  If you add in the over 800 million Facebook users, there is a tremendous number of people we could reach with our products.  Millions of gamers every day are gathering together and talking about the latest games, and we'd love to have that audience talking about Christ and his teachings.  If we were able to reach even 1% of our potential market, we'd have a chance to minister to over 12 million people. 


What are we asking for?

We're asking for pledges, donations, and other financial contributions to help get our studio started.  To get us off the ground for a year of operations, we're asking for $685,000.00 USD. That's a pretty significant amount, certainly larger than most other fundraising campaigns on this site, but it's also a value that we believe to be in reach.  If we can get 1% of the Christians in the United States to donate 1 dollar, we could raise over $1.2 million.


We're offering some pretty neat perks for your contributions at certain dollar amounts, and depending on your feedback, we can adjust the values to provide our supporters with items that interest you more directly.  Since every dollar helps, feel free to donate a dollar amount different than any of the values we presented. We have until Good Friday to try and raise our funds, so even if you can only pledge one dollar, it's a huge help.


If you can contribute other services in lieu of a financial donation, such as office space or legal counsel, please contact us and we'd be more than happy to chat with you. 


The "Campaign Game"

We haven't spoken about any specific game projects yet, and there's a reason.  Every perk over $50 includes an "Executive Vote" to help decide which game project we develop first. We have four projects in mind, and we'll steadily release information about them over the course of the campaign.  Every week, we'll be releasing clues and hints about one of the projects.  Here's where the "Campaign Game" comes in.  If our donors can get us to certain milestones quick enough, we'll stop teasing and spill the beans early.  Here are the four thresholds:
  • $125,000 by January 31
  • $250,000 by February 14
  • $475,000 by March 1
  • $600,000 by March 25

As you can see, the goals are high and the time is short. So tell all your friends and help reveal the projects! Also, we'll have a special prize for the donor whose pledge actually crosses the barrier.


Where will your dollars go?

Well, it's no secret that we're asking for a substantial amount of capital.  To find that large, large number, we have the following considerations:


  • Legal Expenses
    • Forming a business isn't always easy, and we'd like to make sure we have all our ducks in a row.  Solid legal counsel in the beginning can go a long way.
  • Salaries
    • The games won't create themselves (we've already looked into that), so we'll need to pay our talented employees to keep them around.  We also want to be able to provide some healthcare for our team as we want our employees to be happy and worry free so that we can create the best games possible.
  • Development hardware
    • We'll need servers, computers, and some drawing tablets for our artists, in addition to our testing devices (tablets, phones, low-end computers.)  After all, we need to make sure our projects run smoothly on the platforms we're releasing them on.
  • Development Software
    • This is much more expensive than you might think.  Everything from Microsoft Office to Adobe Photoshop needs to be purchased in order for us to operate legally, and we definitely want to operate legally.
  • An "office"
    • We'll call it an office for now, but really we're going to be using any affordable space we can find.  If there's an Internet connection and a place for us to sit, it'll work for now.  It might be a house, a storage unit, or a coffee house, but we'll find somewhere and we'll make it work until we can afford a place of our own!
  • The IndieGoGo Cut
    • We're thrilled to have found IndieGoGo, and their platform is providing a tremendous opportunity for us.  They certainly deserve their commission, but that adds an extra "expense" to us.  We keep the majority of the funds we raise, but a small percentage will go to IndieGoGo.  We just wanted to make sure we're prepared for the sharing of funds.

If we're able to meet our goal, we'd love to continue fundraising to help with other aspects of our studio.  Some of the things we'd be able to do with more capital include:

  • Hiring more employees
  • Developing a larger-scoped project
  • Releasing titles at a lower price point (or free for everyone!)
  • Advertising/marketing

How can you help?

In addition to your financial support, there are several other ways you can get involved and help us get off the ground.  One of the biggest things we can ask is that you share our campaign and objectives with everybody you can think of.  If you can't help financially, maybe one of your friends can, or one of their friends can.  We're relying on our fans to help spread awareness and get the word out.


The second thing we welcome is to interact with us on our social media sites.  We have Twitter, Facebook, and Google Plus accounts in addition to our standard website.  We'd love to be able to share photos, videos, and conversations with all of you, and social networking is the easiest (and most fun) way to do that.  Invite your friends, your family, and your computer-savvy pets to join with us, and let's see how many fans/friends/users we can grab before Good Friday.


The final thing we'll ask you to do is to pray.  We believe in the power of prayer, and if our mission is something you believe in, please think of us in your conversations with God.  Starting a business from the ground-floor is a daunting task, and we can use all the help we can get!

In addition to your financial support, there are several other ways you can get involved and help us get off the ground.  One of the biggest things we can ask is that you share our campaign and objectives with everybody you can think of.  If you can't help financially, maybe one of your friends can, or one of their friends can.  We're relying on our fans to help spread awareness and get the word out.

The final thing we'll ask you to do is to pray.  We believe in the power of prayer, and if our mission is something you believe in, please think of us in your conversations with God.  Starting a business from the ground-floor is a daunting task, and we can use all the help we can get!

story:
What is the game about?

Kings Forge is a sandbox building game for the PC, with an emphasis on multiplayer Kingdom managment and warfare. The game takes place in a procedurally generated voxel world where players can build and destroy structures and items as well as capture land. Inspired by games like Minecraft and Dwarf Fortress, Kings Forge is a unique middle ground of managing your loyal subjects and Kingdom members and a third person action role playing game.


The key aspects that make up Kings Forge are:

  • Kingdoms are created by a group of players and allow you to capture sections of land based upon how many members you have within the Kingdom itself. All captured land is protected from the destruction of other players not within the Kingdom who claim it. Kingdom's also give you access to a wide variety of characters which can be summoned to help perform tasks and guard your Kingdom from invaders.
  • Item Forging is the process of creating clothing and other items from cubes. Much like the world in Kings Forge players can build their own items block by block allowing you to look completely unique and trade your unique items for goods or currency with other players. 
  • Adventures and unique loot are scattered around the procedurally generated world and as you explore it you will encounter warbands of unfriendly monsters and stumble upon tricky boss fights deep within the dark caverns. 
  • Combat in the game consists of melee, range and magic with unique and interesting effects such as igniting your opponents. The unique weapons, spells and buffs available in the game makes combat against both players and NPCs fast and exciting.
  • Modding will be introduced further into the development of the game with the ability to load C# scripts for blocks, actors and items allowing you to make your servers truly unique without the worry that each update to the game will change the API and break your scripts or mods. On top of this the game is currently reskinnable by simply dropping your textures in the skinning folder. This will make mods also very easy to distribute and combine.
  • Building in Kings Forge is similar to that of voxel based games such as Minecraft with a variety of different block types with different strengths and uses. Build for fun or build defensely to prevent other Kingdoms stealing your riches. 
  • Multiplayer is a massive part of the game. Players can host their own persistent servers to play with friends and make new ones. The game is exclusively multiplayer with no single player component and encourages players to work together building and managing Kingdoms.

For information on the development of the game you can visit my blog.

How far completed is the game and where does the money go?

I've been programming, creating art and creating content for Kings Forge for roughly 6 months by myself with the occasional help of a friend creating textures and 3D models for the game, you can view my progress through the development of the game on my blog. I currently have a full time job and cannot afford to work on it all the time. The game itself is roughly 70% done however it lacks a lot of animation and sound content. The money you give will allow me to hire Musicians and Artists for a short period of time to help create the remaining content I cannot create myself. On top of that it will allow me to put a lot more time into the game without worry of financial burden until its alpha release.

What do you get?

All contributions equal or above $5 will get you a preorder copy of the game. When the game reaches its alpha release stage you will be notified by email with a code that will allow you to register an account and download and play the game for free. When the game reaches this stage the price for purchasing it will go up. All contributions equal or above $10 will have access to the closed internal testing of the game which will come before the initial alpha release. All contributions equal or above $30 will have your real or username added to a list of names that characters within the world are randomly assigned. All contributions large or small get my undying thanks! If the target amount is reached I will be able to speed ahead with the remaining development for the game and will hopefully have a closed alpha testing within 2 months, with the alpha release following the results of the closed testing. If the target is not met the game will take a much longer period to finish and may not have music at all.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford or do not wish to donate to the game you can help by spreading the word about the game and helping attract media attention and contributor attention. Or if you are a 3D animator or Musician/Sound Artist and would like to volunteer your time to work on the game and can provide a portfolio of your work I'd be glad to have any contribution to the game that you are willing to give.
