story:
Our Indiegogo campaign is over!

Thank you to everyone who got involved with our project - your support, ideas and contributions have benefited us greatly and for that we are eternally grateful!

While we did not raise our target, we have raised sufficient funds to continue and finish our development... stay tuned for our release in 2014!
story_txt:
Our Indiegogo campaign is over!
Thank you to everyone who got involved with our project - your support, ideas and contributions have benefited us greatly and for that we are eternally grateful!
While we did not raise our target, we have raised sufficient funds to continue and finish our development... stay tuned for our release in 2014!

story:
Releasing on iOS, Android, PC and Mac in mid 2014, Catharsis is a sprite-based steampunk RPG aimed at reaching both a new audience as well as appealing to older RPG fans by changing things up.

Catharsis follows the story of four citizens dragged into a conflict to save their nation; Rhogar, the engineer; Kay, his partner mysteriously brought back from death; Ares, a black market dealer; and Mathias; a bartender with a shady past. As they struggle to restore power to their country, they face off against the rich and powerful Count Arthur who has his own agenda for Textoria.


Dead Teddy Development
For those who haven't heard of us, we're Dead Teddy Development; a small game development team based in Melbourne, Australia. While this is our first commercial project, we are driven with a passionate background in gaming and development and hope to bring you a fantastic steampunk RPG experience with Catharsis.

Despite being an Australian company, our audience is worldwide; with a focus on building a strong community, our initiative is not just to make games that we enjoy, but to listen to you and find out exactly what our community wants and let them help us build it together- afterall, the creative industry can never have enough new creativity.


Creating awesome games isn't cheap. A lot of skill sets, equipment, distribution and licensing, and many more things are involved - and most of these are quite expensive. As you might have seen, we have the Engine ready to go with all the features we'll eventually use, we just need the sprites and art to make this game happen. We have a few of the best artists, programmers, composers, and others working for us, so the bigger our budget, the more quality content our game will feature; such as a greater and longer soundtrack, more sprite assets allowing for more frames of animation and detail, and paying developer fees to submit to marketplaces.

Our team is dedicated to making this game a reality, even if it means working other jobs to pay the bills until we get there. Your help will speed up our timeline significantly though!


We understand that a big part of crowdfunding is to offer rewards for people's generosity. So we've tried to come up with some cool and exciting stuff that even we would love to have!

Apart from all the sweet perks listed here, we have the exciting privilege to offer the first 40 people who donate $20 or more and get in touch with us, to get a free copy on iOS on release day! (We would love to offer more than 40, but this is unfortunately not possible).

To make up for this, we're offering a free copy of Catharsis on PC and Mac, in addition to the soundtrack, to everyone who donates over $20- all you have to do is tell us which platform you would like and we'll get it to you as soon as we launch the game.

Keep in mind, whether we reach funding goal or not, all perks will be fulfilled to donators in time for the game release, or on the release date. We will keep everyone updated through email, social media and of course on our website.

Our perks include...


We will endeavor to send everyone who contributes to the campaign a personal thank you email as a show of our gratitude for helping make this game a reality for us.
Because everyone loves stickers, we're offering several types of sticker designs that you can choose from;
- Logo
- Dead Teddy Dev
- Rhogar
- Kay

While we aren't able to offer promotional downloads of the Android version to contributors, we are giving out 40 iOS copies to the first claimants, over $20, and an alternative of free copies of Catharsis for PC & Mac for everyone else who gives over $20.
As a bonus to everyone who helps us out, all donations above $20 will be given a download link to the Catharsis OST upon final release.

Love the poster illustration? We have it in two sizes; small and medium, signed just for you for showing your support.
Feel the love all year round with a Dead Teddy Dev, Catharsis-themed calendar. Not only featuring some of our artwork and characters, but we'll be sure to have a month dedicated to mentioning the contributors who made a difference and got into the credits!

Wear your support with pride! With several levels of perks to choose from, ranging from smaller donations to the larger, you can get yourself a Dead Teddy Support T-Shirt, or a special Catharsis campaign shirt to show off to all your friends!

Please note the Catharsis Campaign options are limited runs, so get in quick!
Feel like your iPod/iPhone/iPad/Samsung looks a bit bland? Spice it up with one of our cover perks. Same as with the T-Shirts, we have a Dead Teddy Dev Support option, as well as the unique Catharsis Campaign to choose from.
On offer are cases for iPhone 3-5, iPod 4G, iPad 2-4, and Samsung Galaxy S3 & S4.

Same as the shirts, the Catharsis iOS covers are in limited supply, so don't wait too long!

What gamer doesn't want to have their name in the credits? If you pick this perk, you'll be listed as a valued contributor at the end of the game. All perks above this will include your name in the credits too.
Our artist will sit down with some photos of you and transform you into a 2D sprite likeness and we'll put you in the game for people to find and interact with.

Just being there isn't enough? Have your say and give your 2D sprite a one-liner of your own. We'll sit down with you and come up with something witty, profound, or just silly. Within reason of course...
Open to any residents (or visitors) of Melbourne; feel like catching up with the local development team members for a drink? We'd love to meet our new fans and get to know you! Time and location TBD after the campaign ends.

We will have a large world for players to explore throughout Catharsis. Wouldn't it be cool if you could name somewhere after yourself or come up with a unique name? Here's your chance! Within reason of course; no trademarks or copyright names, no profanity, etc.
Within the universe of Catharsis, there's a lot of background and side stories that add depth to the experience. Any writers out there who want to stretch their imaginations and contribute should check this perk out and help us create some awesome stories.

This is the big one. For such a huge show of support, we'll list you in the credits as a co-director of the game and give you a shout-out whenever we talk about the game. That's how awesome you are.

Please bear in mind if you want a perk that requires postage to add somewhere between $5-$10 for postage, as we can't anticipate where everyone will donate from. Also remember that any donation over $20 will net you the perk, as well as the game and soundtrack!


What happens if we go over our funding goal? We've thought about that and we can put your generous donations to good effect!

Firstly, a good portion of your donations will go straight into a marketing balance we can use for both digital and print media. Working with Blind Ferret Media we will be able to reach a wide target audience with specifically targeted game and mobile websites. Facebook marketing can help us reach across the social media network to bring in more fans, and we can try to get some small ads onto the larger game review sites, such as IGN and Gametrailers.

As well as the internet, a secondary market of print media such as flyers, posters, train carriage ads, etc. could be arranged for a small campaign right before release, hopefully bringing up our chances of getting the name of Dead Teddy Dev out there.

Of course marketing would be a main focus, we would also be able to afford to pay our sprite artist and composer for more work, creating a more detailed world for you to explore, as well as purchase any upgrades for programs and hardware we could use to make a better product or potential language translations for other marketplace regions. Rest assured whatever we earn, will be put to good use.


Set in the country of Textoria, a waning culture suffers as the power generation capabilities continue to decline, slowly sending the population into survival mode- black markets, racketeering and dissent emerging in cities and towns across the nation. The Engineering Corps is dedicated to maintaining the largescale steam-generator system that powers the country's energy grid, though they fight a losing battle after the original inventor, only known as the "Architect", mysteriously vanished the day the prototype system was activated. Without his knowledge, the capability to maintain or repair the degradation was limited, and ultimately only delayed the downfall of their civilisation.

Using the Ethanon Engine

Using the Ethanon Engine we have the chance to bring a new look to sprite RPGs. We can render 2D sprites in a 3D environment, giving a whole new depth to the world and the characters; realtime lighting and shadows, shine for metal, and particle effects for things such as fire and rain. Older RPG fans will be familiar with the party micro-managing, but new players will find an easy experience allowing your party to take over the action for you during combat. Characters can be set to automatically take the initiative and attack enemies or heal up when damaged according to preset conditions, or they can be switched to manual control to let the player have greater control over what happens.

Game Features

However we didn't stop there - As you explore the world, the weather can change which not only adds immersion, but drastically affects combat strategies you need to get through alive. This means you'll rarely have the same experience twice.

The more time you spend in Textoria, the more time passes in-game, creating a day-nite cycle to take full advantage of the new look Ethanon gives us. As well as a dynamic world, the current idea of side-quests becoming fetch-quests and grinding for levels, Catharsis takes away levels to have individual attributes to increase, raising character's effectiveness how they like, as well as side-quests being story-based and expanding on backgrounds and adding depth to the people fighting with you. In some cases, this may even effect their combat abilities; a finished side-story is less to worry about so they can focus on the adventure at hand.


Our future in games is only as bright as you make it, and we can't wait to listen to our community and make the games they ask for. So get the word out and share our page and links around with your friends and family!

Also an open invitation to any linguists out there; as an English-speaking team, we would love to work with people to expand Catharsis into other languages. We appreciate all the help we can get!

Thank you for your support, and stay tuned for this exciting adventure steampunk game!

story:
Hi everyone

I am gustavo "d2bowie" . For the past year or so i strived to deliver somewhat concise yet as deep as i could possible deliver dota content on my youtube channel. Every time there's a new patch or a change of play style to a hero i try to research it and keep everyone updated on the high mmr trends. When sven got back in 7.06 i made this one for example:

 As far as my background goes I am a Brazilian chemical engineer dropout that always loved the game and content production in general . I never had a clear goal when I got into this yet I always wanted to get more involved in the scene , that's the reason i chose english instead of portuguese as the language of my channel. Impacting as many people as possible always felt obvious to me even under hard circustances. For a Brazilian I had "decent" english one year ago and i feel like i came a long way (even though my accent has a lot to improve).

While i can say i make a "living" out of dota and that i love making these videos i always wanted to go to the international. That being said, starting a crowdfunding only to attend ti is not my goal here. I want to give back to everyone that follows my work but also to the community.  I want to change the way dota content is made for the 10k redditors as well as the casual viewer.

Don't get me wrong, valve makes amazing content about the players lives . I feel like not too much emphasis is given to the players' styles though. I understand that a team even when they don't change players will switch "styles" because dota is an everchanging game and if you want to keep winning you have to adapt. My channel was always about this though, following trends and talking about them. 

I would also like to add my twist on interviews as well. As i said before, understanding a team's playstyle better would help the casual viewer to grasp what's going on in a deeper way. This type of interview would be aimed at getting more experienced players (that sometimes don't care too much about the players) to see dota through a pro player's eyes. I know that there's a stigma to talk about strats during ti , i get that. My idea would be to ask other pros opinions on what an enemy team did or their ranked game experiences. I feel like some of the awkwardness that comes with pro interviews is that the game gets completely ignored most of the time and that is something they are clearly passionate about:

"Did you like NP's mid visage, why ? " , "What's your most important solo queue tip" , " Why is techies not in cm?" , "If you had to share a room with techies or pudge, which would you choose?"

I wouldn't bombard them with only these type of questions yet having a little bit of dota in the interviews is something i feel like a lot of people would enjoy.

GETTING DOWN TO BUSSINESS

1. What I want to achieve before TI7

I will make a series of 3 videos about the invited teams (if we have more than 3 invites) everyone that donated is going to participate in a pool to vote which teams they want me to talk about (would love to add more, but since i'm on a clock i don't want to promise more than i can chew). I'll try to convey based on their last tournaments:

  • Basic strategy : Who is the star of the team ?  , Top picks ? , Do they fight a lot ?
  • Team mannerisms: What are their common objectives at 10 mins into the game ? Do they smoke mid with their lvl 6 supports ? Do they force the safe lane tower ? Farm is their prioritity ?
  • Expect underground memes and something between purge and slacks in the humour spectrum

  2. During TI7

This one is slightly trickier .  There's a lot of things i want to do yet it's kinda hard to promise pro interviews. I'm a no one. Add the fact that people don't like giving interviews while they are in the tournament and even less after they lose and we have where i am.

I'll try to get as many pro interviews as i can. i hope that if this actually gets funded the visibility of it will help with credibility when i start looking for them.

3. After TI7

What's the biggest problem with these "finals analysis" videos ? They are super long. Even if arteezy made a 3 hour video (naked) talking about them i'm not sure i would actually watch it all. When i first started my channel i always tried to sum up a 40~50 min game in something like a 13 min video. I know important information gets lost in the process but as i said before i'm all about finding a comfortable spot between accessible and informative.

I will make an in depth (yet time friendly) video about every game and i would also like to make a video with pro player's opinions on what happened.  If this gets big and people decide to participate i would love to have a ton of different pros giving their inputs in the finals . This is probably very possible since after ti the patch and the game will change considerably, meaning that they are way less likely to resist on sharing.

What do i need to make this happen  ?

  • equipment : i own a canon g7x ii which is a decent enough camera i feel like . I would need a bunch of extra bateries and memory sticks though.  I would also need decent microphones to get a good final product
  • Two flight tickets from brazil to seattle and 10 days of hotel/airbnb
  • I don't have a ti7 ticket lol  (this is probably the smallest of my problems) . There was the chance of me going with another crew and getting a press ticket but it didn't happen.
  • since i probably won't have enough to actually pay the person that goes with me for their time (7~10 days of filming 12 hours a day is actually damn expensive) i would like to at least cover their food/uber/expenses

Expenses breakdown
story_txt:
Hi everyone
I am gustavo "d2bowie" . For the past year or so i strived to deliver somewhat concise yet as deep as i could possible deliver dota content on my youtube channel. Every time there's a new patch or a change of play style to a hero i try to research it and keep everyone updated on the high mmr trends. When sven got back in 7.06 i made this one for example:

 As far as my background goes I am a Brazilian chemical engineer dropout that always loved the game and content production in general . I never had a clear goal when I got into this yet I always wanted to get more involved in the scene , that's the reason i chose english instead of portuguese as the language of my channel. Impacting as many people as possible always felt obvious to me even under hard circustances. For a Brazilian I had "decent" english one year ago and i feel like i came a long way (even though my accent has a lot to improve).

While i can say i make a "living" out of dota and that i love making these videos i always wanted to go to the international. That being said, starting a crowdfunding only to attend ti is not my goal here. I want to give back to everyone that follows my work but also to the community.  I want to change the way dota content is made for the 10k redditors as well as the casual viewer.
Don't get me wrong, valve makes amazing content about the players lives . I feel like not too much emphasis is given to the players' styles though. I understand that a team even when they don't change players will switch "styles" because dota is an everchanging game and if you want to keep winning you have to adapt. My channel was always about this though, following trends and talking about them. 
I would also like to add my twist on interviews as well. As i said before, understanding a team's playstyle better would help the casual viewer to grasp what's going on in a deeper way. This type of interview would be aimed at getting more experienced players (that sometimes don't care too much about the players) to see dota through a pro player's eyes. I know that there's a stigma to talk about strats during ti , i get that. My idea would be to ask other pros opinions on what an enemy team did or their ranked game experiences. I feel like some of the awkwardness that comes with pro interviews is that the game gets completely ignored most of the time and that is something they are clearly passionate about:"Did you like NP's mid visage, why ? " , "What's your most important solo queue tip" , " Why is techies not in cm?" , "If you had to share a room with techies or pudge, which would you choose?"
I wouldn't bombard them with only these type of questions yet having a little bit of dota in the interviews is something i feel like a lot of people would enjoy.
GETTING DOWN TO BUSSINESS
1. What I want to achieve before TI7
I will make a series of 3 videos about the invited teams (if we have more than 3 invites) everyone that donated is going to participate in a pool to vote which teams they want me to talk about (would love to add more, but since i'm on a clock i don't want to promise more than i can chew). I'll try to convey based on their last tournaments:

Basic strategy : Who is the star of the team ?  , Top picks ? , Do they fight a lot ?
Team mannerisms: What are their common objectives at 10 mins into the game ? Do they smoke mid with their lvl 6 supports ? Do they force the safe lane tower ? Farm is their prioritity ?
Expect underground memes and something between purge and slacks in the humour spectrum

  2. During TI7
This one is slightly trickier .  There's a lot of things i want to do yet it's kinda hard to promise pro interviews. I'm a no one. Add the fact that people don't like giving interviews while they are in the tournament and even less after they lose and we have where i am.
I'll try to get as many pro interviews as i can. i hope that if this actually gets funded the visibility of it will help with credibility when i start looking for them.
3. After TI7
What's the biggest problem with these "finals analysis" videos ? They are super long. Even if arteezy made a 3 hour video (naked) talking about them i'm not sure i would actually watch it all. When i first started my channel i always tried to sum up a 40~50 min game in something like a 13 min video. I know important information gets lost in the process but as i said before i'm all about finding a comfortable spot between accessible and informative.
I will make an in depth (yet time friendly) video about every game and i would also like to make a video with pro player's opinions on what happened.  If this gets big and people decide to participate i would love to have a ton of different pros giving their inputs in the finals . This is probably very possible since after ti the patch and the game will change considerably, meaning that they are way less likely to resist on sharing. 
What do i need to make this happen  ?

equipment : i own a canon g7x ii which is a decent enough camera i feel like . I would need a bunch of extra bateries and memory sticks though.  I would also need decent microphones to get a good final product
Two flight tickets from brazil to seattle and 10 days of hotel/airbnb
I don't have a ti7 ticket lol  (this is probably the smallest of my problems) . There was the chance of me going with another crew and getting a press ticket but it didn't happen.
since i probably won't have enough to actually pay the person that goes with me for their time (7~10 days of filming 12 hours a day is actually damn expensive) i would like to at least cover their food/uber/expenses

Since it was set to flexible funding, backers already got or will get the perk rewards.

story:
A Journey.......

Two brothers Carter and Noah wish to start their own business by starting their own gaming empire.  Carter is a 9 year old with Aspergers and loves Mine Craft and anything to do with Gaming.  His brother Noah is 7 years old and is just in love with the world of gaming and every aspect of it.  

This all started when they wanted to create their own game on IOS App store.  They came up with the idea of Onions, a fun and cute game that requires great hand eye co-ordination to help you get to the top of the leaderboard.  For this goal to be reached they used their own savings and after speaking to a developer who saw their potential and what they wanted to do, helped turned their game idea into reality.   

From there they went on to have another game developed called Present Hunter.  10% from all iAds revenue is donated to Say no to Bullying from Present Hunter  and 10%  from all iAds revenue from Onions is donated to Aspergers Awareness.

They have taken many steps in this journey- from 2 ios games, 1 website idea already out there, and another waiting to be started.  They have started their own You Tube Chanel as well.

Now with their savings gone they need your help and support in their master plan in setting up their business.  

They hope you take the time to review the below and see what they need and where they want to go.

So lets Break it Down for you...

They started this journey by using their school banking, now that they have the majority of the small work taken care, they need your support to help market, promote and further develop their business plan.

The funds will be broken down into the following:

*  Marketing and promoting of their site, ideas. Promoting through as many areas as possible to drive traffic and reach the largest audience. Internet and radio,  $1000

* Futher completion of current website still in progress $600

*  Development of new website they wish to create $700

* Marketing and Promotional Material $500

*  Development and launch of 2 more ios games.  $800

*  Purchase of inventory to also start a small market stall. $800

* Registration of Business Name and Logo $500

This is just a breakdown of the very basics to help with their launch and start they journey.  If they were to receive any additional funding than what is required, they would be putting this aside in a kitty to assist with the continued growth and development of their ideas. 

With their business not only do they want it to grow but also help people along the way..

Your Support

Will help turn their dream into a reality and while they have taken the first steps they also need further support.  For Carter and Noah not only are they wanting to start a successful empire they also want to help people along the way.  The first two groups that they wish to support are Autism/Aspergers Awareness and Say No to Bullying.

With Carter being diagnosed with Aspergers he wants to also show that its not something to be seen  to hold you back.  If you have a dream and really want to do something thing give it a go.  

Noah wants to not only help support his older brother but also help raise the awareness of Say No to Bullying as no one should have to go to school and be bullied and not enjoy their time, as school should be fun with your friends.

For these two brothers it was about finding a common project that they both wanted to do.  They are this excited and motivated already and now want to start making a difference and only time will tell how far they will be able to take it.

    Risks & Challenges

    Their are many challenges that will come their way and they are prepared for the work that is ahead of them.  They know that what they need is support. They have the support of family and friends and they were sucessfull in finding a developer that cares and sees great potential in what they want to do and is offering his support and skills at a reduced cost.

    The risks are that their ideas, site and creations won't get out there and reach their intended audience and this is why the market and promotional material is one of their biggest focuses.

    With your help you can help minimise any risks or challenges that may come ahead.

    Other ways that you can help

    Carter and Noah understand not everyone can help and times are tough and people may not want to take a risk on a kids business idea, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

    *  You can help spread our campaign idea out to as many people as possible.

    *  Check out and Like our Facebook Page.

    *  Check out and subscribe to our You Tube Chanel.

    * Help make as much noise as possible about what we want to do.

    Remember Indiegogo has some amazing share tools that you can use.

    So thanks for taking the time to review and as Carter would Say "Peace" and Noah just a simple "Byyeeeee"

story:
Great news! Orders received now will ship within a week!

"...gives players unprecedented control without compromising on comfort",  Brad Jones at Digital Trends

"The Swiftpoint Z is here, and now mouse makers the world over have a lot of catching up to do”, Overclock3D

"The Z, has analog control capabilities and may have a legitimate claim to 'worlds most advanced gaming mouse' Seth Colaner, Tom's Hardware

 

"This mouse has an accelerometer, gyroscope, 50 buttons, and an OLED display to make you the ultimate gamer", The Verge

"... listen to us when we say the Z mouse, just launched, is a pretty amazing looking piece of kit.", PC Powerplay

"This will be the go-to gaming mouse for the next half decade", Henry Lane - Executive at CerebralFix (award winning game development company).

Page translations here: 点击这里查看中文翻译  | 한국어 번역을 위해서는 여기를 클릭 하세요.  | ここをクリックすると日本語訳を表示します |

 

The Z at a Glance

Swiftpoint’s previous Crowd-funded device,  'The GT'  (shipping now, on amazon.com), earned the Best Computer Peripheral Innovation award, at the largest technology show in the US (The CES). Now, after more than three years of development, we are ready to launch The Z. 

It's the world’s first mouse to pivot, tilt and roll, with a brand new way of clicking buttons - meaning you can access dozens of different button actions while barely moving your fingers. The Z also senses how hard you click, giving variable speed / force control, and provides tactile feedback, so you know when you’ve made a ‘deeper click’. 

If you are a Designer or home and office Power User, please check out the info right after the gaming section. If you’re a Gamer… read on…. 

 

The Z for Gamers 

Tilt Left or Right

 

We’ve made sure that the ability to tilt doesn’t affect the rock solid performance of normal mousing and have designed adjustable and replaceable feet that can make the tilt easier or harder or set a large or small tilt angle. Or if you want, you can lock out tilt altogether.

 

 

Pivot Action

 

The Z also knows when it is pivoting left or right - this gives you a huge competitive advantage in many first or third-person shooters. You can run straight ahead and at the same time look left and right with analog control (the same way as you would with a VR headset). It provides tactile feedback so you know when you’re facing forward, or looking to the side.

Just like tilt, you can assign any action, modifier (e.g control or shift) to a pivot. Everything is configurable. 

Pitch, Roll & Yaw - In the Air or on the Ground

The Z knows when it’s on the table and when it’s in the air. For games like Battlefield, just lift up for in air control. Once you're in the air use the W/S keys for thrust (or lift), and The Z for pitch, roll, yaw.

For longer periods of flight, just place the mouse on the supplied 3-Axis extender and take command with direct free-form control - your hand resting comfortably on the desk.

Another great use for the The Z, is for intuitive camera control in spectator mode.

For Tilt, Pivot and In Air Gestures, we provide further analog support for games that are compatible with game controller’s analog sticks, by reporting to the game that we are simultaneously, both a mouse, and an analog controller.

 

50 clickable button actions.... while barely moving a finger.

Many mice pack in additional buttons around the thumb grip and all over the device. We’ve figured out a new way of clicking that means you can have more buttons, that are effortless to click with no finger or thumb contortions required. 

The Z has a new type of trigger button. It can be used by simply straightening your finger slightly and then clicking – while still gripping the mouse as normal, with your fingers poised on the main left and right click buttons. 

They are so easy to click that you can use them for actions you do frequently, like reloading, jumping or crouching.

You can pull them like a trigger as well. These two buttons are in effect four buttons.
 
We’ve also added adjustable fingertip buttons, that can be accessed with very little finger movement. 
 

Combine pivot and tilt with trigger and fingertip buttons, to effortlessly access over 50 different actions (48 plus left and right click) - all while maintaining a full grip for maximum control on the mouse.

In addition, we incorporated a scrollwheel button,  two front/side buttons, and two thumb buttons, for secondary click actions.

Needless to say The Z makes a great MMO, RPG or MOBA mouse.

The trigger buttons and fingertip button positions are all adjustable (and removable) to perfectly suit your hand size and type of mouse grip.

 

Deep click with Tactile Feedback

The main left and right buttons and two fingertip buttons all support Deep Click.

Configure the amount of force that suits you (from easy to 'off'), and The Z gives you tactile feedback to let you know when it's activated. 

 

 

A look behind the scenes.

We captured some raw video of Grant demonstrating some of the tools we have created to help develop The Z, and also show the '3 axis extender' which we will include for free for each mouse shipped...
 

A Huge Boost in Productivity for Power Users

Home and office power users can use the speed and precision of the most advanced multi-functional gaming mouse to blast through spreadsheets, documents, emails and presentations. 

Tasks like selecting and copying text are faster and more intuitive with the Deep Click pressure sensitive buttons of The Z....

 We also brought ‘copy and paste’ into the 21st century…

You can pan up and down or any direction of a document or image... 

  

A Multi-functional Precision Tool for Designers

Professionals such as artists, surgeons, chefs and carpenters all demand the highest quality, precision tools to perform their work. Now all designers on a computer can have in their hands the best multi-functional precision tool available. 

Panning, zooming and rotation in CAD and Desktop Publishing, is like second nature with The Z, and the  6-axis in-air control opens up a whole new way of manipulating 3D objects,

With software like Photoshop and Illustrator you can use the force sensitive buttons to set brush thickness, the harder you push, the thicker the line. We also use the pivot action of The Z, to allow you to draw sweeping brush strokes that are a more natural and pen-like.

We've enhanced overall precision with a feature we call Tactile Steps. In this mode, The Z moves the cursor one unit at a time, and gives tactile feedback for each unit of movement. It makes increasing / decreasing values extremely easy - and something like 'nudging an object three pixels to the right' can be achieved with absolute precision.

 

 

Rock-solid Performance & Personalised Ergonomics 

OLED Screen for fast configuration

We wanted to make the The Z the easiest mouse to configure, so we added an OLED screen. Lifting The Z to look at the screen is a gesture that we recognize, so we automatically put it into configure mode, to swiftly change profiles, DPI, or other settings. 

No Lag, No Drag

None of us want to worry about batteries or wireless reliability and latency …so while we made the Z wired, we also eliminated the issue of cable drag by building a brushed aluminum cube into the mouse-mat for perfect positioning of the cord, right off the desk surface. 

 

 

Ergonomics and Accuracy

Our last device –  the Swiftpoint GT mobile mouse, was quoted as ‘The Most Comfortable Mouse on the Market’ by The Huffington Post. With The Z, we paid the same attention to a full sized mouse and tested hundreds of prototypes to create what we believe is the best shaped mouse ever built….

The main click buttons have been flattened, so that when you click, you are opposing the desk surface with no chance of nudging the mouse.

We’ve balanced The Z so that when you lift it, the weight is evenly distributed between your thumb, ring and little finger.

The feet underneath are replaceable and adjustable to configure an easier or harder tilt, or no tilt at all. The Trigger buttons and fingertip buttons are also configurable and removable.  You can set your own force thresholds for Deep Click, or turn it off altogether. 

…..and of course… we have the glowing RGB LED logo.

 

 

The Z + Swiftpoint GT Pack!

In response to requests from backers, we have added combo packs for 2 mice. The Z, and our other device, the award winning Swiftpoint GT Mouse.

The Swiftpoint GT, was launched to retail last year and received the best innovation award at the largest trade show in the US (the CES), IT Enquirer even rated it as 'the best mouse of the 21st Century"!  

To learn about the Swiftpoint GT – watch a short video review from the guys over at The Grommet.....

 

 

 

The Specs

 

  

 

FAQ

  • Will The Z be fully supported on Windows and Mac?

    Yes! We are developing specific drivers for Windows 7 and above, and Mac OS.

    What games and / or software will The Z function with?

  • The Z is compatible with all games and applications. You can map any button click, tilt gesture or pivot gesture to a keyboard combination that the application uses.

    For analog functionality we support games or applications that can use both a mouse and analog controller or joystick.

    What is the warranty period on The Z?

  • As with the Swiftpoint GT (our previous device), The Z comes with a 5 year manufacturer’s warranty. We don't see it as 'just a mouse'... more as a precision tool for design professionals and gamers - as such the build quality will be of the absolutely the highest standard.

    How much does The Z weigh?

  • The weight of our prototypes are just 124 grams using 3D printed parts, which is a typical  mouse weight. We are aiming to make it even lighter with thin wall injection-molded parts and lighter components.

    What are the dimensions of The Z, Mouse Mat, and Cable?

  • The size of The Z is similar to most mainstream gaming mice, however The Z has two width dimensions - one over the main body with, the other over the wings on each side.

    Width (over main body): 66mm 
    Width (over wings): 91mm 
    Length: 130mm 
    Height: 43mm

    The Z comes equipped with a 7ft braided cable.

    The mousing area on the mouse mat is 250mm by 350mm (9.8 by 13.8 inches)

    Is there are wireless version of The Z available?

  • No, we've opted to stick with wired to minimize latency and battery issues. In order to to remove the issue of cable drag and tangles, we've created the "No Lag, No Drag" brushed aluminum cable cube.

    How do I get the Swiftpoint gaming mouse mat and / or brushed aluminum cable cube?

  • For the Indiegogo special edition, every backer will receive a bonus mouse mat and brushed aluminum cable cube.

    Does The Z work without the Swiftpoint gaming mouse mat?

  • Yes, The Z has the latest optical pro gaming sensor (the PixArt PMW3360), and doesn’t need a special mouse mat.

    What type of scroll wheel does The Z use, and how do you scroll left and right?

  • We use a high-end mechanical scroll wheel with precise incremental clicks.

    By tilting The Z slightly to the right you can move the mouse for free-form smooth scrolling, not just up / down, but also left and right, to navigate to any part of a document (including to the start or end of the page).

    Is there a left handed version available?

  • No – the mouse is designed for optimal ergonomic use in the right hand.

    We will look at the possibility of a left handed version once we have launched commercially and can measure sales volumes in retail.

    Some of our team members are left-handed and uses the Z successfully, but we recommend right hand use.

    Does The Z work on Linux?

  • Yes it does.

    Out of the box, The Z sends mouse and keyboard actions for all of the buttons and gestures, (and combinations of both) that can be mapped to a function / action in an application.

    We won't be writing a driver for Linux on day one, so it won't be as configurable as with PC and Mac, and won't have the same analog support,

    In the spirit of open source development on Linux, we will publish the USB reports being transmitted from The Z mouse. This will enable third party developers to write their own drivers and gives direct access to force sensor / gyro and accelerometer signals as well as mouse and keyboard signals/commands.
story_txt:

 When playing a game that involves driving - use tilt to take direct analog control of the steering wheel. We’ve made sure that the ability to tilt doesn’t affect the rock solid performance of normal mousing and have designed adjustable and replaceable feet that can make the tilt easier or harder or set a large or small tilt angle. Or if you want, you can lock out tilt altogether.  Pivot Action The Z also knows when it is pivoting left or right - this gives you a huge competitive advantage in many first or third-person shooters. You can run straight ahead and at the same time look left and right with analog control (the same way as you would with a VR headset). It provides tactile feedback so you know when you’re facing forward, or looking to the side.Use Pivot to look left and rightJust like tilt, you can assign any action, modifier (e.g control or shift) to a pivot. Everything is configurable. Pitch, Roll & Yaw - In the Air or on the GroundThe Z knows when it’s on the table and when it’s in the air. For games like Battlefield, just lift up for in air control. Once you're in the air use the W/S keys for thrust (or lift), and The Z for pitch, roll, yaw.Lift up The Z, for a short burst of precise flight controlFor longer periods of flight, just place the mouse on the supplied 3-Axis extender and take command with direct free-form control - your hand resting comfortably on the desk.Place the Z on the 3-Axis Extender for the ultimate free-form control of flight and space simsAnother great use for the The Z, is for intuitive camera control in spectator mode.For Tilt, Pivot and In Air Gestures, we provide further analog support for games that are compatible with game controller’s analog sticks, by reporting to the game that we are simultaneously, both a mouse, and an analog controller. 50 clickable button actions.... while barely moving a finger.Many mice pack in additional buttons around the thumb grip and all over the device. We’ve figured out a new way of clicking that means you can have more buttons, that are effortless to click with no finger or thumb contortions required. The Z has a new type of trigger button. It can be used by simply straightening your finger slightly and then clicking – while still gripping the mouse as normal, with your fingers poised on the main left and right click buttons. They are so easy to click that you can use them for actions you do frequently, like reloading, jumping or crouching.You can pull them like a trigger as well. These two buttons are in effect four buttons.
 
We’ve also added adjustable fingertip buttons, that can be accessed with very little finger movement. 
 

Combine pivot and tilt with trigger and fingertip buttons, to effortlessly access over 50 different actions (48 plus left and right click) - all while maintaining a full grip for maximum control on the mouse.
50 fingertip click actions in 10 seconds!
In addition, we incorporated a scrollwheel button,  two front/side buttons, and two thumb buttons, for secondary click actions.
Needless to say The Z makes a great MMO, RPG or MOBA mouse.
The trigger buttons and fingertip button positions are all adjustable (and removable) to perfectly suit your hand size and type of mouse grip.
 
Deep click with Tactile Feedback
The main left and right buttons and two fingertip buttons all support Deep Click.
Configure the amount of force that suits you (from easy to 'off'), and The Z gives you tactile feedback to let you know when it's activated. 
You can use Deep Click in an analog mode to have direct throttle control or speed when driving, flying or running
 
In a First-Person Shooter… right click to bring up your scope, click deeper to zoom in, then deeper again to hold your breath and steady your sights... now take the shot.
 
For games that have light and heavy attacks, use normal click for a light attack, or click harder to launch a heavy attack. 

A look behind the scenes.
We captured some raw video of Grant demonstrating some of the tools we have created to help develop The Z, and also show the '3 axis extender' which we will include for free for each mouse shipped...
 


A Huge Boost in Productivity for Power Users
Home and office power users can use the speed and precision of the most advanced multi-functional gaming mouse to blast through spreadsheets, documents, emails and presentations. 
Tasks like selecting and copying text are faster and more intuitive with the Deep Click pressure sensitive buttons of The Z....
Double click to select a word, press a bit harder to select the paragraph, then a bit harder again to select the entire document.
 We also brought ‘copy and paste’ into the 21st century…
Deep Click the right button to copy text, and slightly harder again to paste - it’s extremely fast and intuitive with tactile feedback
You can pan up and down or any direction of a document or image... 
Simply tilt the mouse to the right then move in the direction you want to scroll.
  
A Multi-functional Precision Tool for Designers
Professionals such as artists, surgeons, chefs and carpenters all demand the highest quality, precision tools to perform their work. Now all designers on a computer can have in their hands the best multi-functional precision tool available. 
Panning, zooming and rotation in CAD and Desktop Publishing, is like second nature with The Z, and the  6-axis in-air control opens up a whole new way of manipulating 3D objects,
With software like Photoshop and Illustrator you can use the force sensitive buttons to set brush thickness, the harder you push, the thicker the line. We also use the pivot action of The Z, to allow you to draw sweeping brush strokes that are a more natural and pen-like.
We've enhanced overall precision with a feature we call Tactile Steps. In this mode, The Z moves the cursor one unit at a time, and gives tactile feedback for each unit of movement. It makes increasing / decreasing values extremely easy - and something like 'nudging an object three pixels to the right' can be achieved with absolute precision.
 
 
Rock-solid Performance & Personalised Ergonomics 
OLED Screen for fast configuration
We wanted to make the The Z the easiest mouse to configure, so we added an OLED screen. Lifting The Z to look at the screen is a gesture that we recognize, so we automatically put it into configure mode, to swiftly change profiles, DPI, or other settings. 
Lift the mouse to look at the OLED screen, and The Z automatically goes into configure mode
No Lag, No Drag 
None of us want to worry about batteries or wireless reliability and latency …so while we made the Z wired, we also eliminated the issue of cable drag by building a brushed aluminum cube into the mouse-mat for perfect positioning of the cord, right off the desk surface. 
No cable drag
 
Brushed aluminum cable management
 
Ergonomics and Accuracy 
Our last device –  the Swiftpoint GT mobile mouse, was quoted as ‘The Most Comfortable Mouse on the Market’ by The Huffington Post. With The Z, we paid the same attention to a full sized mouse and tested hundreds of prototypes to create what we believe is the best shaped mouse ever built….
The main click buttons have been flattened, so that when you click, you are opposing the desk surface with no chance of nudging the mouse.
We’ve balanced The Z so that when you lift it, the weight is evenly distributed between your thumb, ring and little finger.
When you grip the mouse, the weight is evenly distributed between your thumb, ring and little finger
The feet underneath are replaceable and adjustable to configure an easier or harder tilt, or no tilt at all. The Trigger buttons and fingertip buttons are also configurable and removable.  You can set your own force thresholds for Deep Click, or turn it off altogether. 
…..and of course… we have the glowing RGB LED logo.
 
 
The Z + Swiftpoint GT Pack!
In response to requests from backers, we have added combo packs for 2 mice. The Z, and our other device, the award winning Swiftpoint GT Mouse.
The Swiftpoint GT, was launched to retail last year and received the best innovation award at the largest trade show in the US (the CES), IT Enquirer even rated it as 'the best mouse of the 21st Century"!  
To learn about the Swiftpoint GT – watch a short video review from the guys over at The Grommet.....

   
The Specs

 

  
 
FAQ


Will The Z be fully supported on Windows and Mac?
Yes! We are developing specific drivers for Windows 7 and above, and Mac OS.
What games and / or software will The Z function with?


The Z is compatible with all games and applications. You can map any button click, tilt gesture or pivot gesture to a keyboard combination that the application uses.
For analog functionality we support games or applications that can use both a mouse and analog controller or joystick.
What is the warranty period on The Z?


As with the Swiftpoint GT (our previous device), The Z comes with a 5 year manufacturer’s warranty. We don't see it as 'just a mouse'... more as a precision tool for design professionals and gamers - as such the build quality will be of the absolutely the highest standard.
How much does The Z weigh?


The weight of our prototypes are just 124 grams using 3D printed parts, which is a typical  mouse weight. We are aiming to make it even lighter with thin wall injection-molded parts and lighter components.
What are the dimensions of The Z, Mouse Mat, and Cable?


The size of The Z is similar to most mainstream gaming mice, however The Z has two width dimensions - one over the main body with, the other over the wings on each side.
Width (over main body): 66mm Width (over wings): 91mm Length: 130mm Height: 43mm
The Z comes equipped with a 7ft braided cable.
The mousing area on the mouse mat is 250mm by 350mm (9.8 by 13.8 inches)
Is there are wireless version of The Z available?


No, we've opted to stick with wired to minimize latency and battery issues. In order to to remove the issue of cable drag and tangles, we've created the "No Lag, No Drag" brushed aluminum cable cube.
How do I get the Swiftpoint gaming mouse mat and / or brushed aluminum cable cube?


For the Indiegogo special edition, every backer will receive a bonus mouse mat and brushed aluminum cable cube.
Does The Z work without the Swiftpoint gaming mouse mat?


Yes, The Z has the latest optical pro gaming sensor (the PixArt PMW3360), and doesn’t need a special mouse mat.
What type of scroll wheel does The Z use, and how do you scroll left and right?


We use a high-end mechanical scroll wheel with precise incremental clicks.
By tilting The Z slightly to the right you can move the mouse for free-form smooth scrolling, not just up / down, but also left and right, to navigate to any part of a document (including to the start or end of the page).
Is there a left handed version available?


No – the mouse is designed for optimal ergonomic use in the right hand.
We will look at the possibility of a left handed version once we have launched commercially and can measure sales volumes in retail.
Some of our team members are left-handed and uses the Z successfully, but we recommend right hand use.
Does The Z work on Linux?


Yes it does.
Out of the box, The Z sends mouse and keyboard actions for all of the buttons and gestures, (and combinations of both) that can be mapped to a function / action in an application.
We won't be writing a driver for Linux on day one, so it won't be as configurable as with PC and Mac, and won't have the same analog support,
In the spirit of open source development on Linux, we will publish the USB reports being transmitted from The Z mouse. This will enable third party developers to write their own drivers and gives direct access to force sensor / gyro and accelerometer signals as well as mouse and keyboard signals/commands.

story:
In November of 2011, 7 friends gathered at a highschool lunchtable in smalltown Holbrook, Arizona. We were talking about old projects we had worked on while beginning our game design endevours. That's when one of us said "Hey, let's make a game guys!" The next year saw Propelled Bird Software born. We then began our first project; a puzzle game called "Tesseract." However, we quickly realized that building a game wasn't going to be cheap,  and that we needed money to complete our project to release our baby into the world!

What We Need & What You Get

For starters, we are using the Unreal Development Kit (UDK). In order to sell our game, we need to become a limited liability company(LLC). We also need a commercial license from Epic Games. We also plan on going to the Steam platform, and we have to afford the cost to get onto the platform.

After we crunched the numbers, we need about $600 dollars. This amount would help get the project from prototype to legit game status/

In return for you're donations, we will send you a copy of "Tesseract," as well as a special thanks in our credits!



If you can't donate, you can always share our Youtube page or our IndieDB page(http://www.indiedb.com/games/tesserct) and mention us to your friends!



Help us make games for you.

story:
Time for a true revolution of gaming - INDIEGO Roots of Gaming

The INDIEGO! is a retro, indie and NexGen Video Game Console. Why rebuy your old retro games all the time...? Play your originals on the INDIEGO!

Based on our experiences we made with our work around AROS and the creation of AEROS (www.aeros-os.org). We provide you a single device which can run your existing Amiga (CD32), AROS, DOS, Windows and Linux games. But not only limited to those. 

Just insert for example a CD32 CD and the INDIEGO! will check the disc, recognize the game and offer you to run it. Same for DOS, Windows and Linux and other console games. 

Due to the open character and the support for Homebrew everyone is invited to add more support for more platforms and games. 

To offer also NexGen and all the excellent Indie games available, the INDIEGO comes with a STEAM, a desura and a INDIEGO store client.

 

We have more steam than OUYA

Because the INDIEGO! is a Steambox and it has much more under the hood.

Open means no barriers and no enforcement to register again and again and again.... spend your money where you like.

Others call themself "open" because they use a opensource OS as core... we do too.

In our case we use a system derived from Ubuntu (see www.aeros-os.org for old versions)...  But for our definition this is not "open" enough.

Imagine you registered on STEAM... well stay there and enjoy your games on the INDIEGO with your own account.

You like Desura.. well than use Dersura to get your favorite games..

Check INDIEGO store as an alternative and decide which store offers the best price.

You like Onlive.. ok use it on your INDIEGO straight from your sofa.

This is freedom and not a dictated game library and prices.

And being able to run a game you bought already for PC/LINUX, Amiga and other consoles is nice too. 

INDIEGO! is a platform for digital art. 

Enjoy our Demo Scene channel - watch, enjoy, share your  favorite scene demos for nearly every homecomputer or console straight on your TV. 

Who needs a VJ ; ) 

Is it just us? Or do you like physical media too... we like to collect. 

We will be something really really "special"...you really won't believe it... we add a SD-card slot AND a DVD-RW driver... if the fundrising will succeed we will add a Blu-Ray drive.

Why? Because I like my classic collections and we will re-launch and publish new Indie creations for the INDIEGO. All in a limited and collectible way.. Some on SD-card, some on USB-Stick and some on CD/DVD. 

A drive/ a door allows YOU to add more Homebrew, enjoy and share music and videos with friends and family. 

INDIEGO! Is the easiest target platform for every coder.

Code as always.. chance are very high that the INDIEGO! Will run it. 

Based on a multi-hybrid-OS the system runs a lot of stuff for different CPU-architectures.

Just code in the language you like and embedd the result in a INDIEGO! app container. 

Ask us for more details.

No special SDK needed. We help you to setup the built in SDK's for your needs or to setup your used one on your INDIEGO.

The OS

The core OS is a heavily customized Ubuntu based on our experiences with AEROS. 

The UI is called IGNAS and because design matters we will make it skinnable. 

Due to the low footprint the OS consumes normally less than 128MB RAM.

GAMES, games and even more games

The INDIEGO! will come with many preinstalled games and demos and you can start playing your favorite C64, Amiga (CD32), DOS, Linux and Windows games from day one. 

To allow you to store and collect games, the base systems comes with a 250GB HD (may be higher depending on fundraising).  

We will also support favorite Retro collections like AmigaForever, Amiga Classix, C64 Forever and others. But hey.. we support nearly everything..

Photos, music, movies and Video on demand

The INDIEGO supports a lot of media center applications like AmiMC (aka AMC in the Amiga Scene), XBMC and Plex.  

Who we are

We are a group of retro-amigans and dreamers.. the difference to pure dreamers is that we aren't just talking but we really try something. 

The idea for INDIEGO! comes from Pascal Papara member of Open Invention Network, (Distribution Mainatainer and publisher)

IGNAS the UI is done entirely by Fabio Falcucci (Scuilib, AmiMC, G.E.M.Z, Hfinder and more)

The needed changes to the AROS Kickstart replacement for CD32 are done by Jason McMullan (thank you for helping out and continous support for our beloved opensource OS) 

Our spiritual roots are www.aros.org -> the Opensource reimplementation of AmigaOS and the classic Amiga system.

Our partners are André Nolte for design http://andrenolte.com and www.pack-werk.de for the packaging. 

We would also like to thank to all our partners in the small remaining AMIGA universe.. 

What we need  & What you get

The INDIEGO! will be released for sure... even if this fundraising fails. 

But if it succeeds we can enhance the final result with you! 

With your pledge, we will:

switch from self-build to a cheaper manufactured product.

Reduce the price or make the package even better (more RAM, larger HD, Blueray instead DVD are just a few examples)

Also licensing media codecs for eg.blueray playback cost money.

But even without a pledge, we are looking for help. Tell the world about us. Help us to set up a nice and friendly comunity or be our speakerman in your country. Help to find distributors.. maybe you are systemseller?

Our status, specs and how we plan to sell the INDIEGO!

The work on the INDIEGO! started a long time ago.. in the meanwhile we had 2 prototype systems.

The first one was a dual 1GHZ APU, the second one is dual 1.6GHZ APU and right now we plan the following for the final system:

4x 3.6GHZ APU

AMD HD GPU

4 GB RAM

AMD HD GPU

DVD-RW

250GB 2.5" HD

6x USB 2.0

SDHC-Slot 

HDMI

7.1 HD Audio

All this is planned to be released for SUB 349€ in case the funding fails.. Starting from 100 preorders we can manage to offer it for 329€ and if this fundraising will be succesfull we can go sub 300€. 299,90€ to be honest.

But since design, packaging and development time costs we need your help to achieve this goal. 

We also would like to get some initial funding for PR and early game development.

The first beta machines will be shipped end of march. Official release is planned for the 2nd half of 2013. First dev-kits can be shipped starting from end of march, followed by beta devices. The DEV-systems will be shipped with express shipment within europe.  

The INDIEGO! refference system will be produced and shipped buy us.

Systemseller can obtain a license to build their own INDIEGO consoles. Basically what has be done for the 3DO in the past. Feel free to ask about details. 

The packaging will be made by www.pack-werk.de

The Design of the Logo is done by Andre Noltè who made also the Ares Logo in the past (www.aros-braodway.de). 

Wait a minute... what about the INDIEGO! joypad?

Ha! How if not with the original controller would be the best way to play a retro game?

We support Microsofts XBOX360 for Windows Joypad, mouse and Keyboard... we won't fight the battle about "Firstperson games are played better with joypad than with Keyboard-mouse".. use your favorite input! Use your favorite device from your favorite vendor. Use a Wiimote... use a Competition Pro Joystick.. use whatever you like to use. No barriers. Your choice. Your individiuality. 

Help us to serve every gamers wishes. 

Let's build the one4all system together!

Remember! Even without a pledge you can help us:

Just speak about it, help us to gain some kudos from the gaming world. Share your thoughts.

INDIEGO! the Video Gaming Console funded on indiegogo

 

FAQ

Q: Is this a normal PC?

A: Technically yes but the OS is especially made for a gaming console experience. Think about the first XBOX or any console to which Linux has been ported too.

Q: Ubuntu based? What is the difference to a "normal" PC runing Ubuntu with a bunch of emulators?

A: We don't use "just" Ubuntu as it is. See www.aeros-os.org and www.aros.org for details. We are running a mixture of operating systems to have the best from both sides. Compatibility of Linux and the speed of AROS. Minus the overhead resulting from an normally bloated Linux environment. 

Q: Amiga Kickstart isn't free, how do you provide compatibility to old consoles?

A: We use AROS which is an opensource reimplentation of AmigaOS 3.1. So it is legal.During the development Jason McMullan already improved the compatibiity to run ECS/OCS/AGA and CD32 based games. AEROS is a hybrid and run anything a developer could ask for.

With one click a developer can make an .igo package of his game for one of the supported Platforms. 

Q: Is my money lost if I donate and you don't reach the target?

A: No, you will definetly get at least a discount in the same ammount you donated for www.ares-shop.de. So if you donate for example 50€ and we will start the to take orders for the beta devices, you will get a discount code. 

This fundraising is mainly to collect money in advance and to show potential resellers the public interest. Sure if it would be succesfull "money wise" it would prove it too. But getting Facebook followers is nice too. 

Q: Will it have parental controlls

A: Fore sure, that sure hat whe didn't thought to announce it : ) Yes of course.

It will be a multiuser system. Every person in your home will get its own account and parents can take care about software being allowed. 

Q: What about educational apps?

A: Here comes "having Ubuntu under the hood" very handy again. So yes. Most interactive CDROMs (Windows) will work out of the box. You can also use educational software for Linux and access Web-based services.  

Q: Can I still install Win8?

A:Yes you can. You can also install Operatingsystems like AROS and even those not made for X86 systems.

FAQ
Q: Is this a normal PC?
A: Technically yes but the OS is especially made for a gaming console experience. Think about the first XBOX or any console to which Linux has been ported too.
Q: Ubuntu based? What is the difference to a "normal" PC runing Ubuntu with a bunch of emulators?
A: We don't use "just" Ubuntu as it is. See www.aeros-os.org and www.aros.org for details. We are running a mixture of operating systems to have the best from both sides. Compatibility of Linux and the speed of AROS. Minus the overhead resulting from an normally bloated Linux environment. 
Q: Amiga Kickstart isn't free, how do you provide compatibility to old consoles?
A: We use AROS which is an opensource reimplentation of AmigaOS 3.1. So it is legal.During the development Jason McMullan already improved the compatibiity to run ECS/OCS/AGA and CD32 based games. AEROS is a hybrid and run anything a developer could ask for.
With one click a developer can make an .igo package of his game for one of the supported Platforms. 
Q: Is my money lost if I donate and you don't reach the target?
A: No, you will definetly get at least a discount in the same ammount you donated for www.ares-shop.de. So if you donate for example 50€ and we will start the to take orders for the beta devices, you will get a discount code. 
This fundraising is mainly to collect money in advance and to show potential resellers the public interest. Sure if it would be succesfull "money wise" it would prove it too. But getting Facebook followers is nice too. 
Q: Will it have parental controlls
A: Fore sure, that sure hat whe didn't thought to announce it : ) Yes of course.
It will be a multiuser system. Every person in your home will get its own account and parents can take care about software being allowed. 
Q: What about educational apps?
A: Here comes "having Ubuntu under the hood" very handy again. So yes. Most interactive CDROMs (Windows) will work out of the box. You can also use educational software for Linux and access Web-based services.  
Q: Can I still install Win8?
A:Yes you can. You can also install Operatingsystems like AROS and even those not made for X86 systems.

story:
Spirit Armor - Defend Your Faith is a browser-based game written in HTML5 so it can be played in all modern browsers, including tablets and smart phones.

I have animated one of the warriors from my Christian Fantasy Art series and am creating a world where Biblical principles can be learned while playing games.

You can play a basic one-level demo of the game here. It is very early in production, but you can get a basic sense of the game play.

Spirit Armor is a multi-level game centered on retrieving the six pieces of the "armor of God" as described in Ephesians 6. Each level is a mission to obtain one of the pieces and has its own set of obstacles to overcome. At the end of each level, more Scripture is revealed until the entire Scripture is completed after the sixth level.

Spirit Armor is a fun and entertaining way for kids (and the young at heart!) to reinforce an understanding of this vital spiritual principle.

There is no violence, so it is intentionally very "G-rated". Spirit Armor is challenging, fun, and addictive.

My hope is that this will be the first of many Christian video games that are fun, interactive, educational, and entertaining. Spirit Armor will be available for anyone to play, free-of-charge in the hope of spreading the Gospel and encouraging a new generation of believers!

_________________________________________________________

Other (Potential) Levels

These are early development levels:

_________________________________________________________

Rewards

All supporters at the $25 level and above receive this special edition Spirit Armor dog tag:

Everyone who supports this project at the $100 or above level will receive a special edition Spirit Armor T-shirt!

Everyone supporting at the $75 level and above will receive an autographed physical copy of my art book, Christian Fantasy Art, which features 100 original images of warriors, angels, heaven, and other Biblical topics.

(Those supporting at the $50 level will receive a digital copy of the book.)

At the $250 level and above, supporters will receive this challenge coin:

(T-Shirt, coin, and dog tag designs are not yet final, so feel free to tell me what you think!)

_________________________________________________________

Stretch Goals

If we meet initial funding, we will then move to our stretch goals, which include creating the "mobile app" version for iOS and Android ($15,000 goal) and expanding the number of levels ($24,000 goal).

story:
Imagine Earth is available on Steam Early Access.

All perks (even the final version ones) have now been delivered to our supporters. If you want to receive updates on the progress you can subscribe to our blog: www.imagineearth.info/blog


Play our demo: Direct download or Steam

The final version will be distributed for Windows by DRM-free download. Since we won the Intel Level Up Award for the best Simulation Demo we can offer Steam keys to all backers as well.

Build thriving colonies. Your development strategy shapes the destiny of whole planets from the very beginning. It all starts with landing your settlement capsule on a brave new world. This claims the territory for your colony. Building power plants, farms and factories will supply your people with resources and allow the cities to grow and prosper.

Your people are the heart of your colony and fund its expansion. Only cities with happy people will grow and very happy people will pay you some bonus cash. So you should take care of local pollution and nearby buildings with bad influence.

Only expanding colonies will be provided with additional landing permissions and research budget. Upgrade established technologies or develop new ones. Over 30 constructs and 60 upgrades with different advantages, influences and side effects are available and allow you to build your individual colony.

The strategic placement of your production facilities is vital:

  • The build radius around your city center is limited
  • Some buildings influence each other (e.g. you better don’t place a farm next to a coal power plant)
  • Different field types increase or decrease the productivity of your facilities (e.g. fossil resource fields)
  • Pollution has an impact on your food production
  • Some fields are blocked by rocks or forest (helps to balance the pollution but can also be lumbered for money)


Beware: A fast growing civilization can bring your planet's ecosystem to its limits. Wildfires, dying forests, growing deserts and twisters will arise more frequently and require immediate action. 

Incidents in your facilities can lead to chemical leaks, oil spills or even radioactive contamination. All of them having a really bad effect on your people and the food production. Maintain your buildings and fight catastrophes immediately to avoid this.

Ultimately, you will have to balance the rise of your civilization's greenhouse gas emissions with the capabilities of your planet and new technology. Otherwise global warming melts the ice at the polar caps and the rising sea level will flood your cities!


You stand between the profit goals of the interstellar corporations and the need to preserve the conditions of living for your people. Meet corrupt chiefs and shareholders while your company faces hostile takeover by larger corporations.


Each of the 5 missions takes place on another planet - one order of magnitude bigger than the previous. Every mission will have some unique elements, like cultural heritage sites or even incoming asteroids. Altogether, the story will have 10 to 20 hours of gameplay. Additionally, there will be a Free Game mode that allows you to build your colony in a relaxed way without any goals and a Time Trial mode that maximizes your expansion skills.

Sounds perfect? Apply for a colony management job at Imagine Earth Ltd. now!


Martin Wahnschaffe ( left ) – Programming and Project Managment

I'm a programmer and game mechanic enthusiast since my young days. This experience has been combinded with my university knowledge and several years of working in the software industry as a software designer and project manager. I am well prepared and extremely eager to make Imagine Earth the best game about planetary colonization!

Jens Isensee ( right ) - Artist & Game Designer

I'm a multimedia designer and artist. Besides Imagine Earth as a key project I work on interactive video installations. These are often virtual reality environments based on game engines or sculptured fragile papercraft objects with technical parts and modified hardware in it. I always loved 3d modelling and level design. Check out Melee Island 3D and other projects on my website.


Why are We Asking For Your Help?

We are perfectionists and have been improving the game concept, interface and design since 2008. Now we are satisfied with the gameplay system and basic simulation. It's time to focus on the content and we are crowdfunding for two reasons:

First, the crowdfunding money is an important part of our development budget and will allow is to finish the development until the end of this year. We need it so we can hire specialists to do music, sound and translations and to pay for publishing and legal costs. We use flexible funding, because we believe so much in this game that we will use our own savings or take a credit if we don't reach the 10,000$ goal.

Second, we want to build a community around Imagine Earth that will make it an even better game. This means your are more than welcome to give us feedback and share your thoughts during the further development. We have an ideas category on the project website where we put in future features and possibilities. Check it out!

Learn more about the development plan, on our website.


Stretchgoals

We know that you are eager to read about stretchgoals. We have some ideas, but would love to hear about yours. Tell us here or in the forum what feature we should build if we reach more than 10,000$.


The Perks

Exclusive Backers Wallpaperset - You will get a special set of wallpapers from the galaxies in the game. Plus the special supporter badge for our forums! There you can share your feedback, discuss and vote for features. - 5$ - Badge: "Supporter"

The Finished Game - You will get a DRM-free download of Imagine Earth and keys for Steam and Desura once the game is finished. - 15$ - Badge: "Shareholder"

Your Name in the Credits - A cheap way to immortalize yourself! We will put your name or nickname into the game credits. - 20$ - Badge: "Staff"

See our creative rewards guidelines for more details

Early Access - Get early access to the development version of Imagine Earth on Steam and Desura. This will unlock the missions Tuto and Joma (without the time limitation of the demo) and the free game mode. Additionally, you will receive a new version with the next finished mission ~every two months and be an integral part of our development community. - 25$ - Badge: "Manager"

We created a family of 8 fantastic fonts for the game. Here they are! Get the whole fururistic font pack as .ttf and .otf for unrestricted personal & commercial use. The 5 bucks is almost 90% off from the official myfonts.com price! - 30$ - Badge: "Manager"

Naming Cities - Every city built on the planet will receive a random name (which can be changed by the player). This perk gives you the opportunity to put a name of your choice into the random list. E.g. this could be your hometown, your favourit city or a fantasy name based on your nick name or real name. - 35$ - Badge: "Mayor"

See our creative rewards guidelines for more details

Your Name in the Top 10 - Every planet has a Top 10 leaderboard for it's mission and other game modes. It is filled with ficitonal "players" as placeholders. This perk brings your name or nickname into the Top 10 (ranks 4-9) where every player will see it. Please let us know if you prefer a higher rank or a "better" leaderbord. You can add a tip to receive a better spot. - 45$ - Badge: "Chairman"

See our creative rewards guidelines for more details

Your Name in the Top 3 - Same as "Your Name in the Top 10", but your name will be in the top 3! - 55$ - Badge: "Director"

See our creative rewards guidelines for more details

Become a Landlord - There are various nice continents on some of the most beautiful planets of the universe... Buy one and we put a sign on it: Physically in the landscape which every player can click to read... In the Credits you will be named before all previous backers, e.g. as "Landlord Martin of Utopia". - 300$ - Badge: "President"

See our creative rewards guidelines for more details

We create a character based on your name and a picture of you. You will have a mansion on one of the planets and appear in the story offering a side quest to the players. Get listed in the credits before all previous backers as a "CEO" - 600$ - Badge: "CEO"

See our creative rewards guidelines for more details


FAQ

Flexible funding?! Will this game really be done?

Yes! In fact the crowdfunding is only a part of our development budget. Update #2 explains why we are doing flexible funding.

How will I get my digital copy of the game?

The Early Access version will be distributed with Steam. This means you will have to create a free Steam account to play the Early Access version of Imagine Earth.

The final version will be available as DRM-free download and additionally on Steam and Desura. Keys are included in all perks starting from $15.

When will I get my digital copy of the game?

The Early Access version will be released May 20th. All backers will receive their Steam keys until then.

The final version is planned for December.

For the creative rewards, what are the constraints?

See our creative reward guidelines for more details.

What languages will Imagine Earth be in?

Englisch and German. Tell us what other languages you would like to see.

What about other platforms/Which platform will you use?

So far we support Windows PC only. As soon as the final version is released, we will have a look at other platforms. A Linux and Mac version is very likely and we would also love to build a version for tablets.

What are the system requirements for Imagine Earth?

  • 1 to 1.5 GHz processor
  • 1 (better 2) GB of user memory
  • 500 MB on your hard drive
  • DirectX 10 graphics card (DirectX 9 cards will be fine if they support multiple render targets (MRT), floating-point surface formats and per-vertex texture fetching)
    Example: Old Intel integrated graphics like Intel GMA 950 or X3000 (used by many old netbooks) won't do. Nvidia Geforce 8 and ATI Radeon cards from 2007 will do.
  • Windows XP Service Pack 3, Windows 7/8
