story:
What is This Game?

This Game is a 3D online, multiplayer role-playing game, set in a medieval-fantasy world, with turn-based combat. We avoid calling it an mmorpg because it's different then most online multiplayer games. For one it's build to be easily moded and all the tools that This Game was made with will be  made available. But the most significant difference is that other online game have one or a few powerful servers run by the big companies, private servers (if they appear at all) are run with stolen software and  the big companies often fight and even prosecute people running private servers- but this is not the case with This Game! The server side software will be made available so that anyone who has a internet connection and a computer can host his own server with the maps, models, textures  armors, weapons, monsters and game rules of his own choosing or making.

 

Fund to play.

This Game is also a bit different when it comes to money. If the campaign goes well and the goal is reach then This Game will be Free.  Free as free beer, no fees, no micro payments, client, server and editor downloadable for no money at all. If we don’t reach the goal (it’s quite  lot of money after all) then the client will still be downloadable for free, so will be the editor (so one could still make a single-player module –something like the demo), but the server side software will cost money. 

 

Gameplay.

There are no classes  in This Game. Just 3 aspects - magic, wits and combat. Every time a character gains enough experience to gain a level he or she can select one of these aspects. Raising Magic allows one to use more powerful magic items, cast deadlier spells and resist hostile magic. Raising Combat gives more hit points, increases the damage dealt with melee weapons and alows to use heavy equipment. Wits raises the chance to deliver a critical hit and avoid attacks, it also boost ones action points. To make characters more unique there are also Perks. A few chosen at character creation and others can be obtained during the game for example  after finishing a quest.

   

Craft.

Crafting is an important part of games these days, in This Game it also plays an important role but unlike in most other games items crafted by players are not the most powerful available item, it's quite the opposite. Because there are no skills devoted to crafting and gathering resources is fairly safe and simple, crafting an item costs next to nothing and that's why home-made items are considered low-quality. If you don't like it this way then there's no problem, changing the stats of items is just a matter of editing some numbers in a text file. 

 

PvP

This Game is open for player versus player combat and to make things more interesting the winner can take all the items that the loosing player had with him. Of course murdering random people is not an acceptable behavior and it will  have its consequences.

 

Player housing.

Because a player can loose all the items in his inventory when killed, it is important to have a place where one can safely store his items. A player can rent a chest, a room in an inn, or even a  whole house.   

 

System requirements.

This Game will run on Windows, Mac and Linux. 1 GHz CPU, 1 GB of RAM, a OpenGL compatible video card with 256 memory. The game should run on any computer made within the last 5 years. We do use per pixel lights, normal mapping, soft shadows, off-screen buffers and maybe some other 'advanced' techniques  but players will have the ability to turn all these off. We aim to make This Game playable even on 'netbooks' with integrated graphic cards. The demo we made runs at 70-105 FPS on 1.6GHz CPU with 2GB of RAM and a Radeon HD 3800Series  at 1280x1024.

 

Things that This Game will not have:

  • A Cool Name (unless someone is willing to sponsor it)
  • mounts, pets, henchmen
  • oversized weapons
  • explosions of colored lights with every hit or 'skill' use
  • fountains of blood and gore
  • a facebook profile
  • a version for iPad/iPhone (but there could maybe be a Android version)

 

Get the demo!

(I will provide better or alternative links in the future)

 

 

  • Windows:
    http://www.sendspace.com/file/7vjmk8
  • Linux (AMD64):
    http://www.sendspace.com/file/m9s4g0
  • Linux (i386):
    http://www.sendspace.com/file/b9rljh
  • OSX (i386):
    http://www.sendspace.com/file/2sco7f
  • OSX (ppc):
    http://www.sendspace.com/file/z419hb

This Game is open for player versus player combat and to make things more interesting the winner can take all the items that the loosing player had with him. Of course murdering random people is not an acceptable behavior and it will  have its consequences.
 
Player housing.
Because a player can loose all the items in his inventory when killed, it is important to have a place where one can safely store his items. A player can rent a chest, a room in an inn, or even a  whole house.   
 
System requirements.
This Game will run on Windows, Mac and Linux. 1 GHz CPU, 1 GB of RAM, a OpenGL compatible video card with 256 memory. The game should run on any computer made within the last 5 years. We do use per pixel lights, normal mapping, soft shadows, off-screen buffers and maybe some other 'advanced' techniques  but players will have the ability to turn all these off. We aim to make This Game playable even on 'netbooks' with integrated graphic cards. The demo we made runs at 70-105 FPS on 1.6GHz CPU with 2GB of RAM and a Radeon HD 3800Series  at 1280x1024.
 
Things that This Game will not have:

A Cool Name (unless someone is willing to sponsor it)
mounts, pets, henchmen
oversized weapons
explosions of colored lights with every hit or 'skill' use
fountains of blood and gore
a facebook profile
a version for iPad/iPhone (but there could maybe be a Android version)
 
Get the demo!
(I will provide better or alternative links in the future)
 
 

Windows:http://www.sendspace.com/file/7vjmk8

Linux (AMD64):http://www.sendspace.com/file/m9s4g0

Linux (i386):http://www.sendspace.com/file/b9rljh

OSX (i386):http://www.sendspace.com/file/2sco7f

OSX (ppc):http://www.sendspace.com/file/z419hb

story:
Hi everyone,

We're launching this campaign to help our friend Renee Knipe. She recently underwent surgery, and though insurance knocked it down from a five-figure bill to a four-figure bill, we're still talking about thousands of dollars. This unexpected surgery was necessary, but the bills are piling up.

Your contributions will help -- it all goes to paying for this surgery, and to making sure that there are no future complications.


The Reward

We're offering a single reward to all contributors, because you're all good friends for helping out!

The bundle of PDFs contains six RPG publications:

ViewScream: A live action game for video chat software. Terror in space!

Secondary Systems: An expansion for ViewScream that introduces new characters and play styles.

In Space, No One Can See The Strings: ViewScream with puppets! That's right, puppets!

Class Reanimation: A Fiasco playset about a bunch of monsters who attend their 10th high school reunion.

Pandemoniacs: A Fiasco playset about gun-toting exorcists in an ultraviolent splatterpunk world.

Inchoate: A Fiasco playset about a search for meaning amidst the carnage.


Why we're launching this campaign

You may know Renee from her contributions to the Forge, or Story Games, or the Google Plus RPG community. In any case, you know that she's a cool person, and she could use your help!

We're showing solidarity with to someone who's supported her friends and community, and who's been dealt a bad hand. Your donations will help her pay for much-needed medical care. Every contribution, even $1, helps!

You can also help by spreading the word via Facebook, Twitter, G+, email, or anything else you can think of.


Thank you so much for your support!


Best regards,

Arnold Cassell

Brianna Sheldon

Eric Duncan

Rafael Chandler

story:
Screeps is the first strategy sandbox MMO game with a persistent open world where you play by writing JavaScripts to control your units' AI. They live within the game and operate autonomously even while you are offline. This is a completely different experience of an online game which you have never tried before. A radically new idea you should positively have a look at!

Wait… JavaScripts?

Yes! If you are a programmer, didn't you think the last time you played your favorite online game that it would be cool to automate it somehow? Be honest: you did. Because it makes lots of sense: why waste precious time making routine actions that any bot could perform equally well? Why should you manually enter the game daily just to get a reward if a script could do this for you? No more wasting time on dumb movements even a child can do. We, grown-ups and programmers, can do much better. Screeps not only allows scripting, but moreover, it's a game wholly about scripts!  

What it looks like

In Screeps, each player writes an actual JavaScript program which controls the play. By managing resources, base, and units, you fight for dominance in the gaming space inside one huge persistent real-time universe. However, instead of traditional manual point'n'clicking, you build AI which controls everything without your direct interference. Think of it as macro-management of the world with the help of some Matrix-like computer, but you are in charge of how it works!


Your units continue living their lives even as you are offline! Just write a script, and they will mine and build. Improve your script, and they will conquer and defend. And all of this – while you are at work, sleeping, or walking your dog. Automagically.

There is no session match-ups: units of all players coexist in the same real-time persistent open world and obey the same rules.

You could build a large empire with a complex network of roads, sourcing, mining, manufacturing, border defense which would live on its own, while you would occasionally drop in from time to time just to check the situation and polish your scripts, if needed. Everything is ok, up and running? Fine, isn't it why you are a programmer? Ask for pay rise! :)

Screeps may be called a platform game. If you are a programmer, you well know how to study API docs and build an app upon an existing framework. Screeps gives you an opportunity to apply your skills to compete with other programmers (including right in your office) in a way you never thought was possible!

Game concepts

In Screeps, there is much programming and few game mechanics you need to understand, so now we'll summarize them all.

The game world consists of interconnected rooms. A room is a closed space 50x50 cells in size. It may have 1-4 exits to other rooms. A number of rooms in the world is limited, but increases as new players join the game. So the single game world is really huge and constantly expanding, like the Universe itself.

What is there in the rooms? Five types of surface (plain land, roads, swamps, ramparts, and walls), energy sources (the main game resource), and, of course, your units and buildings.

Spawns are your colony centers. They can accumulate mined energy and use it to create your units. There may be no more than 3 spawns in a room. Hence, by bulding 3 spawns in a room you actually conquer it.

The more spawns you build and hold, the higher your position in the Global Player Rank of the current game season.

You build units called creeps the same way as in other strategy games, but with one exception: you construct the "body" of a new creep out of 7 available body parts, the resulting body being a sequence up to 30 parts. It allows thousands of creep types and their roles: ordinary workers, huge construction machines able to harvest a source within a few cycles, weaselly couriers, heavy capacious trucks, fast and cheap scouts, well-equipped fighters with regeneration ability, etc. It may even be creeps resembling towers or fortresses for mining, defending, or seizing, with very little speed (couple of cells per minute), but monstrous characteristics. Everything is up to you, your tactics and imagination.

However, remember that any creep has a life cycle of 30 minutes. Then it "ages" and dies. So you need not just to control existing creeps but set up manufacturing and automatic control of superseding generations of your creeps.

Aside from creating creeps, you have to take care of infrastructure of your rooms. The roads you build allow slow creeps move faster which leads to effective logistics, the ramparts block movements of your opponents and give extra defense, while the spawn extensions allow building more powerful creeps.

Demo Playground

To show you how it all will look, we set a live Simulation Playground that you can play with right away! In this version, your scripts work the same way as in the real game, but are executed inside the browser, not on our servers. Right now you can try:

Tutorial – Learning basic game concepts step by step.

Survival Mode – Defend (or, more exactly, program defense) from computer-lead creeps, wave after wave, trying to stay as long as you can.

Custom Mode – Modify the landscape, create any objects, and play for two virtual players at once. This way, you can test your scripts without interfering with real objects and with no limits on CPU performance.

What is done so far

We have completed the entire game engine, game mechanics, and scripting gameplay! To make sure of it, just have a look at our live Simulation Playground .


What is left to do: fix the bugs, refine the server part, polish the balance, and the most important thing – buy and tune servers, so that your creeps could exist in the shared persistent world with other players rather than your browser.

The Indiegogo campaign will help us complete all the works on time and determine how much server resources we will have to purchase. But anyway, Screeps will go live regardless of the campaign results.

Timeline

This is what will happen in case we will reach the target. 

December 2014, Global Survival Mode Leaderboard. It will display individual scores and ranks of all the players of the single-player Survival Mode. You will be able to match your scores and compete with the best players from all over the world.

January 2015, Early Preview. It will start a month prior to the general availability of the game. Early Preview will be available only for Indiegogo backers with $10 or more. It will be a fully working multiplayer version with the purpose of testing game balance and equipment. At this stage, all the players with access to Early Preview will be able to get any service plan for free. After this stage is over and all the final fixes are made, the world data will be wiped. However, your scripts will stay, so you will enter the general launch armed to the teeth.

February 2015, General Availability. General Availability release will be launched in February 2015 after wiping the world data and exiting the Early Preview stage. You can start spending your CPU Credits from this moment.



Stretch Goals

$30,000 – The game engine will be open-sourced letting you learn the underlying mechanics and run a game simulation on your local machine in console as Node.js package.

story:
www.afallenforest.com / www.facebook.com/AFallenForest / @RTSharpUK

In the Gallery

  • Video: Brief Crowdfunding Pitch from Project Creator
  • Video: Evolution of a Tower

Press:

  • Article: www.indiegamemag.com
  • Feature: www.conceptartworld.com

What is A Fallen Forest?

A Fallen Forest is an indie AS3 narrative tower defense flash game that follows the journey of the Red Squirrel Ash and his Badger companion Silver as they return to their homeland for the first time in years. As they get closer to home however, it becomes clear all is not what it seems… 

  • A Fallen Forest will be free-to-play online

Based on the decline of forest wildlife worldwide, the game will also link real-world wildlife and environmental organisations to a wide and varied global demographic, providing an engaging platform to promote real causes.

The game is a collaboration between myself, Robert T Sharp, a UK Native now living in Ontario, Canada (BBC, UK Film Council) and Italian programmer Davide Beltrame aka Brolyweb (Ferrari, Alfa Romeo, Pavesi, Kellogs) along with several globally award winning artists. 

 

Why should I Start Throwing you some Finance?

Simply put: To finish the game. So far I have fully self-funded the project. Because of this, the button of control is with me. I have been able to work with and support a small group of talented individuals from around the world, each of whom deserve to go far and have brought their own style and essence to the project. Gaining the $800 USD needed to complete the game from Indie Gogo would realise not only my vision and effort, but provide the team with a platform from which to build further success. The project has the potential to be enjoyed by literally hundreds of thousands of people world-wide. You have the power to be part of the project and part of that success. 

More specifically your money will go towards creating original, high quality:

  • Level Maps with Unique Animation 
  • Character Upgrade Animation 
  • Sound FX

Why Squirrels?

I'll be honest, they're hilarious.

Characters

Ash

Young, motivated and tactically sound, Ash has spent the last 4 years fighting the on front lines against the Grey Squirrel’s in foreign lands. Grown wise through the horrors of conflict, his military skills have been honed by consistent training and real life combat. His home forest was always too small for him and the only way out was through military conscription. He dreams of exploration, but must head home again before his next adventure…

Silver

 

Newly retired, axe wielding and cheerfully drunk, Silver has had many years of experience on the front lines. Meeting Ash when he first arrived in his regiment, a bond was forged instantly. Heralding from the same forest as Ash and with a palate for drinking only the finest in alcoholic beverages, Silver was looking forward to retiring with his own pub at the heart of the forest community. Until he returned…

Fluffy

 

Rare and unknown. Other forest dwellers know nothing of her kind’s existence and it has remained that way since time immemorial. Comfortably living within the tunnelled and cavernous depths of the land, she has been forced to the surface in search of revenge. Discovering no-one on the surface, she has decided to hide and wait…

Dusk

 

Abandoned at a young age, Dusk’s earliest memory was of her first kill. Starving, cold and without shelter, that first field mouse taught her a valuable lesson. To trust her own instincts. Since then she has remained alone and has perfected her art. She watched the forest grow silent and cherished the solace, until unnatural life began…

Myrm

 

She maintained the connection to her hive for as long as possible. Their voices became increasingly erratic and she couldn’t guide them any longer. Heralding from a long line of powerful wood ant ancestry, for the first time in their history Myrm is forced to move on alone…

Why create A Fallen Forest? 

With a dawning realization. After several years of successfully creating and working on independent film productions (short films, documentaries and a feature film), I was able to transfer my production skills and experience to the interactive sector to create games, which is where my main creative passions thrive. I have an innate desire to create and tell a good story well, and the interactive world opens doors to possibilities you simply cannot achieve within the screen sector.

As a fan of Beatrix Potter, I’ve always wanted to create a darker twisted world with members of the animal kingdom as protagonists. A Fallen Forest is that world.  

The huge and varied demographic free small games like A Fallen Forest have throughout the world allow a fantastic platform for real-world causes. This project is my 'prototype' in providing exposure to issues related to the game.

A Fallen Forest is also one way of respecting the Darwinian struggle of... squirrels... with Shakespearean gravitas while creating an awesome interactive graphic novel/tower defense hybrid of a game for thousands of people to enjoy.

Tell more more… 

A Fallen Forest in this first-step flash-game form, is a work of primarily 2 pieces: 

An Interactive Graphic Novel… 

Influenced in my early years by the work of Neil Gaiman (in particular ‘The Sandman Chronicles’) among others, a graphic novel-esq format was the perfect choice to tell this particular story and for flash games due to file size restrictions for where the game will eventually end up. The interactive graphic novel in combination with the game gives it a unique platform for story-telling.

 …And Tower Defense Game

One of the most popular genres of free online games there is. I remember playing with enthusiasm the custom Tower Defence maps people had created for Blizzard’s Starcraft way back when. Influences in the flash form come from Game in Bottle’s Gemcraft series, Ironhide’s Kingdom Rush and Iriysoft’s Cursed Treasure. 

For those not in the know, the basic premise of a tower defense game is simple: Stop things attacking your stuff. 

Gameplay

You control up to 3 characters of 5 in defending yourselves against an undead threat, interwoven within the storyline. Each character has unique abilities and each team of characters you choose means creating different tactics to combat your enemies. 

Soundtrack

One of my personal highlights for the project to date is having the UK’s greatest modern Metal band Sylosis provide the soundtrack to A Fallen Forest from their album Edge of the Earth, courtesy of Nuclear Blast Records. They have just released their new album Monolith and will be touring the US (supporting Lamb of God) until the 16th of December 2012. 

Stretch Goals

There is so much more we could do with additional funding, but I won't jump the gun just yet...

Where is A Fallen Forest going? What’s in store for the Future? 

Once the game has been completed, it will be launched online for anyone to play for free. From here, it will be further developed for mobile devices. The game is first chapter in the world of A Fallen Forest. I am also writing an ebook exploring in more detail the origin of the characters, which those who pledge $15  and up will receive upon completion in early 2013. Further chapters of the game will follow with enhanced game mechanics, art and animation. All of this depends on your support.

The Team

  • Robert T Sharp: Creator/Producer UK/Canada
  • Davide Beltrame (Brolyweb): Programmer Italy
  • Thibault Fischer: Concept & Titles Artist France
  • Fernanda Frick: Graphic Novel Artist Chile
  • Jonathan DC. Del Mundo: Flash Artist Philippines

The game is first chapter in the world of A Fallen Forest. I am also writing an ebook exploring in more detail the origin of the characters, which those who pledge $15  and up will receive upon completion in early 2013. Further chapters of the game will follow with enhanced game mechanics, art and animation. All of this depends on your support.
The Team


Robert T Sharp: Creator/Producer UK/Canada

Davide Beltrame (Brolyweb): Programmer Italy


Thibault Fischer: Concept & Titles Artist France


Fernanda Frick: Graphic Novel Artist Chile


Jonathan DC. Del Mundo: Flash Artist Philippines

story:
Thanks to the support of the community, this visual novel is now released! It's available as a PC game for Windows, Linux and Mac OS, on Steam and itch.io.

You can find our store pages here:
http://store.steampowered.com/app/578900/
https://rollingcrown.itch.io/demonheart

Features

  • Female protagonist.
  • Immersive conversations with multiple choices.
  • Friendships, romances or love-hate relationships with other characters.
  • Custom alignment system for the main character, measured by two scales: Good/Evil and Tactful/Defiant. Your alignment shifts depending on the choices you make, and the game reacts to it.
  • A journal that gets filled with world lore.
  • A demon talking in your head. 3:)
  • Intrigue and betrayal.
  • Grey morality.
  • Secret endings.
  • Replayability value.
  • Game resolution is 1920x1080 (widescreen), but it adjusts to fit any screen ratio between 4:3 and 16:9. No FPS limit.
  • Mature content (17+): bad language, violent themes, graphic blood and gore, sexual references.

 

 

We got accepted on Steam Greenlight! Thanks everyone!

 

Here is what the game currently looks like (though we are planning to add some more features):

 

The story

Bright is a young woman from a small, peaceful town. Dark times have come for her family, but luckily, she has the favor of the famous healer-witch Orchid.

 

Benevolent, calm and beloved by all, Orchid hides dark secrets that Bright begins to uncover.

Bright is drawn into a world of darkness and treachery.

 

 

It seems she can never be alone again - for a powerful demonic presence has taken an interest in her activities, and his voice enters her mind at the most inappropriate times.

 

 

 

There are also others who play a significant role in Bright's new life...

 

Ari, a young apprentice witch seduced by bad influences. She tries to be friendly, even though she knows Bright is meant to be her enemy... or is she?

 

Sir Brash, a notorious evil knight who develops a soft spot for Bright, but has a rather special way of showing affection...

 

...and other adorable individuals.

To rebuild her life, Bright has to resolve the situation with her Infernal patron. Will she embrace him, fight him, or decide to merely tolerate him for being a powerful ally?

 

Because we are a small team and we want to give each section of the game special polishing attention, the game will be split into 5 chapters. Your choices and personality will be carried over from one chapter to the next.

Each chapter will be around an hour and a half of play time.

Chapter 1 is planned for early access and testing in October 2016, and for release in December. From there on, a new chapter should be ready every 3 months.

Chapter 1 - Descension (October/December 2016)

Chapter 2 - Reverie (Winter/Spring 2017)

Chapter 3 - Deception (Spring/Summer 2017)

Chapter 4 - Inferno (Summer/Fall 2017)

Chapter 5 - Devotion (Fall/Winter 2017)

 

Jovana: Writer and programmer
I have worked on game mods for years before deciding to create a standalone game. I've always wanted to create the kind of characters that were missing in the big developers' games - mostly bad guys to be romanced by the player.

Radomir: Programmer and technical support
Games have always been my passion and I'm a big technology enthusiast. My current role in life is being a dad and I'm eagerly waiting for my kid to become old enough for us to play and make games together :)

We depend on freelancer talents to produce the game resources, and so far we've funded their work ourselves. Our most reliable associates have been Sibin Aćimović (background artist), Ngô Xuân Hùng (character artist) and Ronggowisnu Prihadi (character animator).

We are so happy with what everyone has accomplished so far, and hope that you can help us to continue funding our amazing artists.

 

Here is what we need to complete all 5 chapters:

Basic goal - $1500

 

  • 50% - Finishing art and animation
  • 30% - Proofreading, sound effects, miscellaneous
  • 10% - Perk expenses
  • 10% - Indiegogo and PayPal/bank fees

Partial voiceovers - $3000

Selected lines of the non-player characters' dialog will be voiced over.

Full voiceovers - $5000

Every spoken line of the non-player characters' dialog will be voiced over.

 

$3 - Sneak Peek

  • Get the 1st chapter of Demonheart on Steam and DRM-free.
 

$10 - Demonheart

  • Get all 5 chapters of the game as they are publicly released, both on Steam and DRM-free.
 

$15 - Confidant

  • Get the Demonheart reward + early access. Learn the secrets of the demons and witches before everybody else!
 

$25 - Patron

  • Get all the previous rewards + special thanks in the game's credits. For those of you who wish to see this project reach its full potential and be forever remembered as our patron saints. :)
 

$35 - Locked Heart

  • Get all the previous rewards + a heart shaped padlock with one of the characters' portraits. Free worldwide shipping.
 

$100 - Celebrity [claimed]

  • Get all the previous rewards + your portrait featured in a major character's home.
  • "There was a mysterious [man/woman] watching me from the painting. Who was this stranger, I wondered. Perhaps a person of significance in Orchid's life, or a respected ancestor..."

$125 - Infernal Idol 1

  • Get all the rewards from the Locked Heart perk + appear in a portrait in a secret lair in Inferno; as a witch if you are a woman, as a demon if you are a man (chapter 4).

$150 - Infernal Idol 2 [claimed]

  • Get all the rewards from the Locked Heart perk + appear as a statue in a secret lair in Inferno; as a witch if you are a woman, as a demon if you are a man (chapter 4 or 5).
 

Thank you for taking the time to consider this project.

Please share this campaign with anyone you know who might like the game.

Thank you to everyone who has made a contribution or helped spread the word
!

story:
When all usual superhero names and superpowers are being used he shows up – SuperMegaGuy.

Weird Hero – is a comic and a bit crazy “shoot 'em up” with 2D graphic and classic Contra-or-Metal-Slug-like control. The story takes place today in fictional city called Necity, where a common man gets as non-super “powers” as possible: a gun and a mask. After that he declares himself as a superhero and starts to fight against the evil forces. 

Project goals:

  • To make short, but a as dynamic and interesting game as possible with different kinds of weapons, enemies and locations.
  •  To rate the interest of community in such projects. 

Weapons were made at the present moment: 

Pistol – a common gun. 

XLGun – huge revolver. So heavy that the Hero has to pull it along the ground and lift to shoot. Slows down the walking speed and lowers the jumping high. After every shot, the recoil knocks the Hero in opposite direction. Bullets are very strong and fly through enemies. 

Triple-barreled gun – literally a shotgun with three parallel barrels. Shoots normal bullets three at once. 

Atomic toaster – shoots radioactive toasts that blow up when touched enemies. Toasts can bounce 3 times off walls, then stick to one and blow up later.  This weapon is a referance to one great game from early 00s, third part of which still isn't released. 

Flickanator – melee weapon. Kicks off enemies and throws back to enemies their shrunken, knives, barrels, Molotov cocktails and other throwing weapons.


Enemies been made at the present moment: 

Biker with bat – common melee enemy. Goes closely and after short pause, attacks. 

Biker with knives – common ranged enemy. Throws knives. 

Tough biker – patrols the area or throws barrels. When hero goes nearby, the Biker grabs him, beats few times and throws. 

Biker on bike – passes by and throws molotov cocktails. Also can crush the Hero. Blows up when dies and deals some damage by it. 

Ninja – misterious assassin, comes out of nowhere and fades out in clouds of smoke. Appears in Level 2 as enemy spy. His main goal is to break through to the driver's cabin and stop the train. But he also can attack the Hero. Partly invisible until the fight begins. Uses shurikens as weapon. Can dodge bullets. 

 

Samurai – immortal eternal warrior. Has a goal to kill the Hero, follows him all the time. Can block bullets and slice radioactive toasts. However, attacks after third block and can be damaged. Burns in blue flame when dies but in some time revives again. 

God of Zilla – giant lizard of the Mesozoic. Can be found in Level 2 (possibly in Level 3) and attacks the train with fireballs. 

Tyan – big flying anime-head. Attacks with eye lasers when the Hero is near.


Partly made locations: 

Level 0 – Prologue. Just ran away from bikers without any weapon. 
Level 1 – Level 0, reversed prologue, but with weapon this time. 

Level 2 – Arena level on the train. The goal is to gain the spead (125 km/h) before the timer run out and save the train. The train can be destroyed by God of Zilla that was accidentally walking by and throwing fireballs (to protect the train the shields have to be on). Meha-cyborg on the train's tail and ninjas inside are going to attempt to stop the train (meha-cyborg is not created yet). 

Level 3 – Level on half-destroyed high-rise. The goal of Level is to find a way to the top of building. 

However, it's all that is done now. There's going to be more weapon, more enemies and more levels of course. And you can help it to come true by supporting the project.

At the present moment I won't set any straightgoal but if required amount of money would be overtop, extra money will be used for art, music and advertising for the game.

story:
ABOUT US

We are based in Perth, Western Australia. Everyone on the design team has either graduated from or are currently studying in a field in the game development industry. We are all passionate about what we do and can't wait to bring our first game to market. This campaign is about the future of the Perth Games market. Have you ever wanted to be part of the beginning of a movement? This may be your opportunity. Most of the team currently work Full Time in other jobs and build this project spare time. What we are finding is licenses for software because what we find is that due to license restrictions on software, we have choke points where work gets tied down. With some extra funding we will purchase more licenses for software that we use to make this game, so that if one person has a heavy workload, others can assist as the company will have more than one license. With you donations we can bring the future of mobile gaming into your hands sooner, and begin the movement towards redefining the industry together.

 

How much and what you get

We believe that $2500 will be enough for us to purchase enough extra licenses for us to be able to bring this game to light sooner. Here is a break down of costs of software we use

3dS Max floating license - $1505

Adobe Creative Cloud 1 year - $600

All our backers will get beta access. Play the game before we launch in the stores. On launch, all our backers will get free items delivered to inbox dependent on pledge size. If we don't make the full amount of money for this campaign, we will put what we do make towards the software licenses, starting with z-brush.

Our Stretch goals

If we exceed these figures we will use extra funds to get another license for software that is less used

Protools perpetual licence - $559

Ableton 10 perpetual license - $449

 

Risks and Challenges

Risk 1 - People getting burnt out and the game not finishing

We have experienced this on a small scale getting ready for this campaign. People pushed really hard for 2 weeks in order to get things ready. To counteract this we all take small breaks for a couple of days to gather ourselves. We only work on the project 6 days per week as we all have day jobs so we need time for family and friends. All the staff are invested in the project through the profit sharing model put in place so the entire team feels like it is their project.

Risk 2 - The game not being liked when its released

We will be testing the game at various stages. We already have people lining up to alpha test for us. We are building a community of followers who all want to see us succeed and we have an open door policy. We build games for the player and we actually listen to our players (or future players) when they provide us feedback. Because of this we feel that the game has every chance of being well liked when it is released.

Challenge 1 - The game being too big and taking too long

We have already scaled some thing back to make the deadline for launching this campaign so we understand big scopes. We have management meetings on a regular basis to track progress, we have a structure in place to ensure steady progress and we also have people on standby ready to work for us if we need to. We have put these things in place because we understand that the scope of the game is quite large and we would rather mitigate that now then have no plan and worry about it later.

 

Other ways you can help

Don't have any spare money to help us on our way? That is absolutely fine. Help us spread the word and any people that do pledge to us and were referred by you, we will offer a special referral bonus to you. While it may not be as large as someone who pledged money, we understand that you have pledged your time so we will also reward you. Just remember to get people to let us know who referred them so we can reach out to you. Facebook, twitter or simply the Indiegogo share tool can all be utilized. This is the one time that gossip is not only liked, its encouraged.

story:
Dear Olympian,

We are Ana, Andrei, Angi, Ela, Ovi and Ralu and we call ourselves #Coubertin's Crew (#GașcaLuiCoubertin) - we proudly take our name from baron Pierre de Coubertin, the father of the Modern Olympic Games. We enjoy volunteering at sporting events and we want to inspire and help others like us discover such opportunities. 

Out of 242.757 applicants, all of us were approved as volunteers at the Rio 2016 Olympic Games. So this year we have the chance to gain valuable experience for the community of volunteers we want to build. But in order to get there, we need your help.



Olympic Games volunteers


Once the Modern Olympic Games came to life and spread all over the world, a group called "Olympic Gypsies" appeared among the organisers. These people are specialists in fields that are essential for staging the world’s biggest sporting event: the Olympic Games. 

Alongside them people who just wanted to help appeared and so the volunteering phenomenon took off. Today, volunteers are a vital part of organising the Olympic Games. They are praised in all speaches and even take their own oath in the Opening Ceremony of the Olympic Games.

The Rio 2016 Organising Committee counts on the know-how of 84 modern-day nomads and a big community of volunteers from around the world, a family we are also part of. 

The Impact


We are #Coubertin's Crew, a group of sport volunteers from Romania passionate about Olympism and its values: excellence, friendship, respect. We aim to create a sport volunteering culture in our country. 

For us, the Olympic Games are a milestone in our journey. On the long term, we want to build a community of sport volunteers and facilitate their participation in sporting competitions. We want to contribute to the organisation of high quality sporting events in Romania, both for competitors and volunteers. This way, athletes will feel the Olympic values from their first competitions and volunteers will be proud to have helped organise them.

Our project started when we found out we were selected as #Rio2016Volunteers. Although we have different experiences, we all strive to educate people in the Olympic spirit and we want to promote sport as a mean of enriching yourself physically, mentally and spiritually.  

Why do we need your support?


Being part of #Rio2016 is a great opportunity, but it's also a big financial effort for us. As volunteers, we only receive the uniform, some meals during our shifts and free transportation between venues. Which means that the main costs, the flight tickets and the accommodation in Rio de Janeiro, are our responsibility. We estimated the costs at 3000 euro (3400 dollars)/person and we need your help to raise a part of the money.
 

Why support us?


All of us have had plenty of volunteering experiences (in NGOs or educational/cultural events), but being part of the Rio 2016 Olympic Games will give us a chance to consolidate our competencies which we will bring to the community of volunteers. By supporting us you will:

  • make our Olympic dream come true;

  • catch a glimpse of the Olympics in real-time through our materials (videos, articles);

  • become an advocate of the Olympic values (excellence, respect, friendship);
  • contribute to the first community of sport volunteers in Romania.

What do you get?


We hope you will want to join our community of volunteers, tell your friends about us, think about us while watching the Olympic Games and be proud to have helped this initiative. The perks we prepared will connect you to our journey:

As Coubertin's friend you will get to know about our journey to Rio and our experience as volunteers at the Olympic Games through periodic updates. You will support us with 1$.

If you want to be a Supportive Fan, Athlete or Olympian, beside the updates you will get a thank you letter from us. You will support us with 5$, 10$ or 25$.

As a Bronze medalist you will also get a country pin as a way to connect with sport events. You will support us with 50$.

As a Silver medalist, you will get a dedicated video of our Rio experience and public acknowledgement of your contribution on our website and Facebook page. You will support us with 100$.

You, the Gold medalist, will also have the chance to talk to us after our Rio experience via Skype. You will support us with 150$.

As an Olympic record man we want you to have the chance to meet us live in Bucharest and hear all about our Rio experience. You will support us with 250$. 


How else you can help


As volunteers we learned that we can make things happen, even when resources are scarce, so here is what you can do to support us:

  • Put us in contact with  people / organizations that might be interested in supporting us on our way to #Rio2016;
  • Share our campaign in your own voice and thoughts;
  • Like and share our Facebook page and visit our website;
  • Give us feedback on this campaign - Contact us;
  • Spread the word about the possibility of volunteering at Olympic events and more.

Final word


Here we are at the end of our story, ready to embark on our journey to Rio full of enthusiasm, curiosity and eager to learn more about volunteering at sporting events. We don't know how #Coubertin's Crew will look like in 5 years time, but we definitely know we will put our energy into bringing more of the Olympic movement in Romania. 

If you decide to be one of our supporters, we hope our roads may intertwine at some point and you will get to see our work. Maybe you will even be part of #Coubertin's Crew and share with us the Olympic values.
story_txt:
Dear Olympian,
We are Ana, Andrei, Angi, Ela, Ovi and Ralu and we call ourselves #Coubertin's Crew (#GașcaLuiCoubertin) - we proudly take our name from baron Pierre de Coubertin, the father of the Modern Olympic Games. We enjoy volunteering at sporting events and we want to inspire and help others like us discover such opportunities. 
Out of 242.757 applicants, all of us were approved as volunteers at the Rio 2016 Olympic Games. So this year we have the chance to gain valuable experience for the community of volunteers we want to build. But in order to get there, we need your help.



Olympic Games volunteers

Once the Modern Olympic Games came to life and spread all over the world, a group called "Olympic Gypsies" appeared among the organisers. These people are specialists in fields that are essential for staging the world’s biggest sporting event: the Olympic Games. 

Alongside them people who just wanted to help appeared and so the volunteering phenomenon took off. Today, volunteers are a vital part of organising the Olympic Games. They are praised in all speaches and even take their own oath in the Opening Ceremony of the Olympic Games.

The Rio 2016 Organising Committee counts on the know-how of 84 modern-day nomads and a big community of volunteers from around the world, a family we are also part of. 

    The Impact

We are #Coubertin's Crew, a group of sport volunteers from Romania passionate about Olympism and its values: excellence, friendship, respect. We aim to create a sport volunteering culture in our country. 

For us, the Olympic Games are a milestone in our journey. On the long term, we want to build a community of sport volunteers and facilitate their participation in sporting competitions. We want to contribute to the organisation of high quality sporting events in Romania, both for competitors and volunteers. This way, athletes will feel the Olympic values from their first competitions and volunteers will be proud to have helped organise them.


Our project started when we found out we were selected as #Rio2016Volunteers. Although we have different experiences, we all strive to educate people in the Olympic spirit and we want to promote sport as a mean of enriching yourself physically, mentally and spiritually.  

Why do we need your support?Being part of #Rio2016 is a great opportunity, but it's also a big financial effort for us. As volunteers, we only receive the uniform, some meals during our shifts and free transportation between venues. Which means that the main costs, the flight tickets and the accommodation in Rio de Janeiro, are our responsibility. We estimated the costs at 3000 euro (3400 dollars)/person and we need your help to raise a part of the money.
 

    Why support us?

All of us have had plenty of volunteering experiences (in NGOs or educational/cultural events), but being part of the Rio 2016 Olympic Games will give us a chance to consolidate our competencies which we will bring to the community of volunteers. By supporting us you will:

make our Olympic dream come true;
catch a glimpse of the Olympics in real-time through our materials (videos, articles);
become an advocate of the Olympic values (excellence, respect, friendship);



contribute to the first community of sport volunteers in Romania.



What do you get?


We hope you will want to join our community of volunteers, tell your friends about us, think about us while watching the Olympic Games and be proud to have helped this initiative. The perks we prepared will connect you to our journey:
As Coubertin's friend you will get to know about our journey to Rio and our experience as volunteers at the Olympic Games through periodic updates. You will support us with 1$.
If you want to be a Supportive Fan, Athlete or Olympian, beside the updates you will get a thank you letter from us. You will support us with 5$, 10$ or 25$.
As a Bronze medalist you will also get a country pin as a way to connect with sport events. You will support us with 50$.
As a Silver medalist, you will get a dedicated video of our Rio experience and public acknowledgement of your contribution on our website and Facebook page. You will support us with 100$.

You, the Gold medalist, will also have the chance to talk to us after our Rio experience via Skype. You will support us with 150$. 
As an Olympic record man we want you to have the chance to meet us live in Bucharest and hear all about our Rio experience. You will support us with 250$. 

How else you can help

As volunteers we learned that we can make things happen, even when resources are scarce, so here is what you can do to support us:


Put us in contact with  people / organizations that might be interested in supporting us on our way to #Rio2016;
Share our campaign in your own voice and thoughts;

Like and share our Facebook page and visit our website;


Give us feedback on this campaign - Contact us;

Spread the word about the possibility of volunteering at Olympic events and more.


Final word

Here we are at the end of our story, ready to embark on our journey to Rio full of enthusiasm, curiosity and eager to learn more about volunteering at sporting events. We don't know how #Coubertin's Crew will look like in 5 years time, but we definitely know we will put our energy into bringing more of the Olympic movement in Romania. 

If you decide to be one of our supporters, we hope our roads may intertwine at some point and you will get to see our work. Maybe you will even be part of #Coubertin's Crew and share with us the Olympic values.

story:
Hi there! My name Aurora Wolf aka Lauren Carlisle. I am a final year Graphic Design student at Cleveland College of Art & Design!
  My campaign is in aid of creating a card game for my final major project for my degree. I've always had a passion for board games and why not enjoy what you designing and do something you can also use in the future!

Your generous and appreciated contribution would be going towards the production, printing and presenting of my final major project. I have designed the cards and content myself so all I need is too get them printed and presented for my degree show with all promotional material. 

I need enough funding to order in tester packs and be able to change any of the designs and re order them before the 1st May! Eek!

Anyone who donates £12 or more will in turn receive a copy of the game if they so wish but the amount funded will effect how many receive the game. 

This is an important project to fund as its my degree, its my final major project. I've been through hell within this degree due to personal circumstances so to pass my degree would mean the world to me and your funding would help achieve that! 


Some of the risks I may face are delivery and postage issues and print mistakes from the company I am getting my cards printed with but as they are a professional company I don't expect but with be prepared for mistakes. 

Obviously asking for donation feels a bit cheeky and not everyone can throw there cash at us students so if you could just spread the word of this project that would be amazing!

story:
OVERVIEW

11 years after the disappearance of his son, Jack Norwood is brought back to the rural town of Staten. A call from an old friend Scott Clarke lead detective on your son's case brings you back home. As Jack follows the trail to unearth the truth, he might find out things have never been what they appeared in Staten.

Search the enigmatic rural town of Staten to learn the truth and find out who or what is behind the mystery.

 

 

GAMEPLAY

The Missing Few is a single-player mystery, horror, adventure game. Explore the small town of Staten, a semi-open world. Discover clues that will eventually lead to figuring out who or what is behind the mysterious disappearances that plague the town; and your past. Obtain items and solve puzzles that will help open up new areas. Examine the personal possessions, notes, and letters left behind.

STEALTH

A realistic stealth system, built into a dynamic environment. Use bushes and tall grass to hide and see enemies through walls. You can distract foes by throwing objects to get their attention, but beware - they can hear you.

INVESTIGATE

Collect items and clues to solve puzzles. Audiotapes with music and audio logs can also be collected and played in various locations of the world.

 

FEATURES

  • Ray Traced Spatial Audio in Unreal Engine 4 using Wwise by Audiokinetics. We have designed The Missing Few to sound like you're actually there in that game world.
  • A semi-open world with interactive environments with no loading screens, we level stream everything for the player after initial loading.

  • A realistic stealth system, built into a dynamic environment. Use bushes and tall grass to hide and see enemies through walls. You can distract foes by throwing objects to get their attention, but beware - they can hear you.

  • Collect items and clues to solve puzzles. Audiotapes with music and audio logs can also be collected and played in various locations of the world.​

  • Intelligent A.I will react to noise, light, and lures. Enemies will search the last known location of the player.

  • Fully dynamic adaptive music, and ambiance.

 

 

 

 

AUDIO

This game features the Wwise audio engine with fully dynamic adaptive music, and ambiance. Wwise is the most advanced, feature-rich interactive audio solution for games.

This game is designed with 7.1 headphone users in mind. You will hear the wind, the rustling of leaves and snapping of twigs all around you.  Hear A.I footsteps around corners and on the other side of walls with pinpoint accuracy.

RAY CASTING SPATIAL AUDIO

What is spatial audio? Spatial audio is a way of creating sound in 360 degrees around a listener. In The Missing Few, we are fully utilizing this approach to audio to copy the way we hear in real life.

We have spent considerable time making the world of The Missing Few, sound as realistic as possible.

ENGINE

We are using a modified source code version of the Unreal Engine 4.24+.  We are using the power of the Unreal engine to create a seamless experience, no loading screens.

 




WHY INDIEGOGO?

We at the Missing Games Studio have developed this project using our own funding and labor for over two years time. We are a small game studio of only three people. We cannot release the game on our scheduled release date, however until we pay for license fees required by Audiokinetics following our trial period that ends on the release date. This campaign is for the sole purpose to allow more time to work on the game instead of for the money to pay for the below fees. The Missing Few will release on its release date.

The following plugins are currently on trial until our full release and are on a per-platform basis.

Wwise Limited Commercial License Wwise Core License - Free under 150k budget.
Auro-Headphone - $300
SoundSeed Bundle (Impact, Air) - $750
Wwise Convolution Reverb - $500
Wwise Reflect - $750 

The above costs including growing server costs, domain, dev kit, and development costs, is a few of the reasons why we are coming to you here on IndieGoGo. If funding is successful we will work towards PS4 and Xbox One Console releases post Steam Release.

If we can succeed with our Indiegogo fundraising goal, we will be able to fully utilize our creative resources on “The Missing Few” going forward. Thank you.

 

CUSTOM MOUSE PAD

 

EGLX GAMING EXPO


 

 

OUR TEAM

 

ABOUT US

We're a small fully independent international team, full of passion and love for games.

Founder and Lead Developer, Eric Lavallee

3D Lead and Material Guru, Connor McKee

3D Artist and Prop Master, Oleksandr Tykkoiev

 

 

SOCIAL LINKS

You can find us on various social platforms please visit us at the following.

https://store.steampowered.com/app/1103960/The_Missing_Few/

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCiNct143fYJoipdaLcNJaBg

https://www.igdb.com/games/the-missing-few

https://www.indiedb.com/games/the-missing-few

https://www.facebook.com/TheMissingFew/

https://discord.gg/gmEwhd


THANK YOU

Thank you for taking the time to check out “The Missing Few”!

 

E-mail: themissingfew@outlook.com

Questions are always welcome!
